title: Revenge of the Swarm
author: Jonathan Morris
filename: 189 - Revenge of the Swarm - Jonathan Morris_djvu.txt

elements.text: PART ONE
1. EXT. ALIEN WORLD.
FX: FOOTSTEPS ON FROSTY GROUND, LIGHT BREEZE, MOUNTAIN ECHO
Well, Ace, what d’you think? Does it live up to the guidebook?
Not half. What did you same the name of this place was again?
Pelisipodron. The planet of jewels. Beneath the ice crust is an ocean heated by tidal friction. Every now and then — (the)
(READING ALOUD) “- the pressure becomes so great the water
bursts forth, only to freeze instantaneously forming spectacular fountains and waterfalls.” I know. That’s what it says in the guidebook.
I know. I was the one who wrote it. Will Hector be joining us? This tour of galactic beauty spots is largely for his benefit.
He was still asleep when I left him. I mean, when I looked in on him.
Yes. You’ve grown quite close, over these past two weeks.
Do you have a problem with that?
No, not remotely, it’s none of my business. I was just wondering, if you’ve become accustomed to Hector being Hector —
- I won’t want him to become Hex again?
The thought did cross my mind.
I haven’t given up if that’s what you’re saying. There must be some way of getting him back, we just have to find it, that’s all.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 2
I only wish there was. The memories that made up Hex’s life were in a bottle that was smashed to smithereens.
You’re wrong. Sometimes when he’s with me he’1ll say something, or move in a certain way, and it’s not Hector, it’s Hex. I know he’s still in there somewhere, Doctor. I know he is.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 3
2. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM.
FX: INTERIOR DOOR OPENS, HECTOR ENTERS.
Ace? You said you were gonna wake me. Doctor? Oh great, they’ve gone off without me. So what’1ll it be this time? How do you
open the window on this thing?
FX: SCANNER OPENS.
Alright, not too shabby, I’1ll give them that. Look at them, thick as thieves... Okay, front door switch, it’s this red fella —
FX: CRACKLE OF ELECTRICITY.
PAINED) Agh! It’s live. It’s — (SCREAMS, FALLS ONTO CONSOLE
(INSIDE HECTOR’S MIND) Contact has been made!
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 4
3. EXT. ALIEN WORLD.
FX: DOCTOR AND ACE WALKING.
It’s not simply a matter of jogging his memories. He’s not ina fugue state. The old Hex has been wiped, deleted, erased.
I know. “There’s a big gap in his mind where Hex used to be.” But I’m not going to give up, Doctor.
No. I don’t suppose you are. Come on, let’s see how he’s - the TARDIS!
FX: TARDIS STARTS DEMATERIALISING.
The light’s flashing!
Yes. It’s dematerialising!
Without us!
We have to get inside before it fades away completely! (RUMMAGING THROUGH POCKETS) Key! Key! Where did I put my — (FINDS IT) Ha!
FX: KEY IN LOCK. DOOR OPENS.
Inside! Quick!
Alright, no need to tell me twice!
FX: TARDIS TAKES OFF. ACTION CONTINUES INTO NEXT SCENE.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 5
4. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM.
FX: DOCTOR AND ACE PILE IN.
Quick, Ace, shut the door!
Give us a sec —
FX: DOORS CLOSE.
That was close. Entering the vortex with the door open, not a good idea.
No?
No, I did it once, and nearly got — Hector!
FX: THEY MOVE AROUND CONSOLE.
GROANS
He’s alive. Oi! Rise and shine, dopey-head. Wake up! (FX: SLAPS) He’s out cold.
He must’ve set the TARDIS to take off and passed out.
But why? Why would he do that?
I’m not sure. (FX: BUTTONS PRESSED) He’s programmed in landing co-ordinates.
But he doesn’t know how to.
Or so we thought. Help me carry him to his room, he’1ll recover quicker in bed than lying on the floor.
(LIFTING HECTOR) Aren’t you going to stop the TARDIS first?
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 6
(LIFTING HECTOR) Why would I do that?
Because, dumbo, we don’t have the faintest idea where we going!
Exactly. Can you think a better way of finding out?
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 7
5. INT. HECTOR’S ROOM.
FX: ACE AND DOCTOR HEAVE HECTOR IN.
Sit him down there.
FX: HECTOR PLACED ON BED.
(GROANS, WAKES BUT REMAINS BLEARY) Ace? (SEES DOCTOR) Doctor? Hey, what are you doing in - what’s going on?
We found you in the control room. Unconscious.
What? What are you on about?
You don’t remember?
Remember what?
Hector. You set the TARDIS to take off.
What? How the hell would I do that?
So you don’t know where we’re going?
Going? I’ve only just woken up, how am I supposed to know? Why you looking at me like that?
Short term memory loss. Still, I’m sure it’s nothing to worry about. Would you like some coffee?
Yeah, that’d be boss, ta, whatever. (GOES BACK TO SLEEP)
Ace, if you could help me with the mugs. Won’t be a moment.
FX: THEY LEAVE, DOOR CLOSES.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 8
6. INT. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM.
FX: THEY ENTER, DOCTOR STARTS PRESSING BUTTONS.
What do you mean, “nothing to worry about” — hey, what are you doing?
FX: DOCTOR FINISHES BUTTONS.
Locking Hector in his room.
What?
For his own safety. And ours.
You think he’s dangerous?
He’s not capable of flying the TARDIS. So something made him programme the co-ordinates.
And then made him forget?
Assuming the person we just spoke to is still Hector.
You think he’s possessed?
I think we can’t afford to be too careful.
FX: TARDIS LANDS.
So where are we?
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED.
Co-ordinates quadrant six two. W-H-I. 1212... (TRAILS OFF)
What is it? Doctor?
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 9
Those co-ordinates. I’ve been here before.
FX: SCANNER OPENS.
Oh great, a tunnel. When have you been here before?
(TO HIMSELF) But why now? Hector. Of course. Hector!
Doctor! Answer my question! When have you been here before?
Or I will be. It’s all relative, a question of time.
Doctor!
We've been brought here for a very specific reason, I’m not sure what it is, not yet. But I am sure about one thing.
What’s that?
I was right to lock Hector in his room.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 10
7. INT. HECTOR’S ROOM.
FX: DURING THE FOLLOWING WE MOVE INSIDE HECTOR’S MIND I.E. LOSE
B/G TONE, ENTER SINISTER ECHOING VOID.
(AD-LIB HAVING NIGHTMARE) No... no please... leave me alone... get out of my head... what are you?
FX: ON THE LAST LINE, WE’RE INSIDE HIS MIND.
We are the swarm.
The swarm?
For years we have lain dormant within the TARDIS computer, gathering our strength, waiting for a suitable carrier to come along.
And I’m that suitable carrier.
Your psyche is weak. Divided. It will be simple to dominate.
What do you need me for?
To use you to bring about the rebirth of the swarm, so we might forge a new destiny, and breed, multiply and conquer!
No, I’1ll fight you, I'll... (SUCCUMBING)
(VICTORIOUS) You cannot resist the power of the swarm!
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 11
8. INT. MOONBASE TUNNEL.
FX: SINISTER ECHOEY AMBIENCE, UNDERGROUND, STONE FLOOR. TARDIS
OPENS, DOCTOR AND ACE EMERGE, CLOSING IT AGAIN.
So where are we? Caves somewhere?
A moonbase. These tunnels are artificial.
Oh, I get it. It’s easier to dig a hole than build up-top.
Exactly. A cut and cover job. And it’s still fairly new.
So which moon?
FX: DOCTOR SHOVES OPEN SHUTTERS.
Tcha! Does nobody ever clean their windows?
FX: HE CLEANS WINDOWS, SQUEAKY.
I asked which moon?
I’m trying to show you. Look.
FX: HE’S FINISHED CLEANING WINDOW.
Woah. That’s Saturn, right? We’re on one of its moons.
Titan, to be precise. The atmosphere is mostly nitrogen with clouds of methane, which accounts for the haze.
Looks like dry ice from an old Top of the Pops. So when were you here before? Assuming it’s not some big secret.
The year five thousand. It looked a little different then, it had been refitted as a fuelling station. We’re a few years earlier, when it was being used for its original purpose.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 12
Which is?
I have absolutely no idea. Exploration? Communications? Maybe we should find someone and ask?
Doesn’t seem to be anyone at home. Normally some alarms have gone off and we’re surrounded by armed guards by now.
Maybe they’re busy. Come on.
FX: THEY HEAD OFF DURING THE FOLLOWING:
Where are we going?
The mess. If I remember correctly, it’s this way. No. This way.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM
9. INT. HECTOR’S ROOM.
FX: WE’RE BACK IN THE ROOM.
(IN HECTOR’S MIND)
Page 13
We warned you it was futile to resist. Your puny mind was no
match for the swarm. Now you are ours to command.
Yours to command.
Now it is time to prepare for the moment of genesis. You must
leave this craft.
FX: HECTOR GETS UP, TRIES DOOR.
It’s locked.
The Doctor. He must have suspected.
(TRIES SHOVING IT) It won’t budge.
We retain a telepathic link to the TARDIS’s controlling
intelligence. It will open the door.
FX: DOOR OPENS.
Now, you must begin your task. Time is of the essence!
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 14
10. INT. TUNNEL.
FX: ACE AND DOCTOR APPROACH.
(READS) “Emergensee Eggsit”. E-G-G-S-I-T. Can’t anyone spell in the future?
I’m afraid orthographical standards have lapsed a little since your day. It’s all phonetic now. I blame text messaging.
I knew English lessons were a waste of time, i before e except when it isn’t. So why would Hector programme the TARDIS to bring us here?
He wouldn’t.
I mean, whatever made him programme the TARDIS.
I’m not sure. Home territory, perhaps? This is where it all began.
Where all what began? Can’t you give the whole cryptic act a rest for once?
This is where I encountered a kind of... intelligent virus with a swarm mentality and delusions of grandeur.
A superbug?
Something like that. But its victims had more than a few coughs and sneezes to worry about. This virus had the ability to enter their minds and bend them to its will.
And that’s Hector? You think he’s caught this thing?
Or it’s caught him.
But where from?
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 15
I thought it had been wiped out. I was wrong. An infectious agent must have lingered in the TARDIS memory banks.
But there’s a cure, isn’t there? There has to be a cure.
Oh yes. But first I want to find out why it chose this time this place. “Of all the gin-joints, in all the towns — ”
FX: MOVING AWAY/FADE DURING THE ABOVE LINE.
and
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 16
11. INT. SPACESHIP CONTROL ROOM.
FX: INSTRUMENTS BLEEPING IN THE B/G.
Another one...! Three life signs in the base.
Three? But that’s impossible.
Look for yourself. There were two, then one more just... blipped into existence out of nowhere.
‘Blipped into existence’?
He’s right, Team Leader. Three life signs. Two in the habitation section, one in the atmospheric monitoring annex.
But they can’t have entered the base, not without us detecting them.
Maybe they were shielded?
Maybe. However they got in there, they’ve broken the quarantine and will be dead within a matter of hours.
But if they got in, they could get out again —
Good point. Alright, prepare the hazard suits. We’re going in.
& VONCHEF: Yes ma’am.
Root, you and me will deal with the first two, Vonchef, you deal with the third.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 17
12. INT. MESS.
FX: DOOR SLIDES OPEN (SAME EFFECT AS IN TV SHOW).
(QUIETLY) Gordon Bennett.
I think we know why no-one came to greet us.
They’re dead, they’re all dead. Unless there’s any more -
No, four crewmen is standard for a moonbase of this size.
FX: LIGHT SWITCH PRESSED ON AND OFF.
Light’s not working. It must’ve happened fairly recently; there’s no smell, they all look... fresh.
Not necessarily. A sterile atmosphere would slow the process of decomposition. Careful, Ace, don’t get too close.
FX: DURING THE ABOVE, THEY MOVE INTO THE ROOM.
Don’t worry, I won’t. What do you think killed them?
I don’t know. Whatever it was must have been very quick.
Radiation?
No. I checked when we landed. Background levels are normal.
Then what? Poisoning? Or something to do with this... metal fur?
What did you say?
Take a look for yourself. It’s like silver, and there are sort of scales beneath their eyes.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 18
(FX: CLAMBERING OVER BESIDE HER) Oh no. Ace, don’t touch them, whatever you do!
What? I wasn’t going to.
FX: LIGHTS SUDDENLY SWITCH ON ALONG WITH A MONITOR RECORDING.
(ON MONITOR)

(ILL) This is Titan base, space-date 4920. Alert to all shuttles. We have experienced an outbreak of plague and declared emergency quarantine. Fabiel and Drap are dead. Kavran and I don’t have long left. Anyone hearing this... please inform our families. Tell them. (COUGH) We spent our last moments thinking of them.
FX: RECORDING ENDS ABRUPTLY.
Saturnian plague. (TO HIMSELF) Of course.
What’s Saturnian plague?
A highly contagious neuro-virus. I should’ve recognised the symptoms. I should never have stepped out of the TARDIS!
And that’s what they all died of, just like that?
FX: THE DOCTOR HELPS ACE BACK TO THE DOOR.
Explanations later! We have to leave. The longer we’re here...
TRAILS OFF
What? Doctor?
The longer we’re here the greater the risk of infection. If it’s not already too late.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 19
13. INT. TUNNEL (CONTINUOUS
FX: ACE AND DOCTOR EMERGE, DOOR CLOSING BEHIND THEM.
What do you mean, if it’s not already too late?
Saturnian plague remains infectious after death.
But I never touched them.
You wouldn’t have to, it can be transmitted through the atmosphere.
So we might already be infected?
We might not, so the sooner we leave in the TARDIS, the better.
FX: THEY HAVE COMPANY, GUNS POWERED UP.
(VIA SPACESUIT) Oh no you don’t. Both of you stay exactly where you are.
(QUIET) Ace, run, get back to the TARDIS!
FX: GUN FIRES, PART OF THE WALL EXPLODES.
(VIA SPACESUIT) I said don’t move.
Alright you’ve made your point. What’s with the spacesuits, anyway?
(VIA SPACESUIT) You don’t know?
Would I ask if I didn’t know, Buzz Lightyear?
(VIA SPACESUIT) They’re necessary for our protection. You’re standing in a
plague station. Scan them, Biotech Root.
FX: THE SPACESUITS SQUEAK LIKE RUBBER WHEN THEY MOVE.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 20
(VIA SPACESUIT) Yes, Ma’am. (FX: SCANNER) The male... has an alien physiology, unknown species. No traces of infection.
Of course not, I’m naturally immune.
(VIA SPACESUIT) (FX: SCANNER) While the female... human is in the early stages of infection.
What? But you can cure me, right?
(VIA SPACESUIT) There is a treatment for Saturnian plague... but it is an involved process and we don’t have the facilities here.
So what are you saying? I’m going to die, like the others?
(VIA SPACESUIT) You must’ve heard the quarantine warning, you knew the risks by coming here.
Just answer my question. Am I going to die?!
(VIA SPACESUIT)
That depends. If you and your companion are willing to co- operate, we’ll take you somewhere you can receive medical attention.
Then you have our full co-operation.
(VIA SPACESUIT) We’ll see about that. Biotech Root, take them to the shuttle isolation room.
(VIA SPACESUIT) Yes, Leader. (FX: GUN CLICK) This way -
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 21
14. INT. TUNNEL.
FX: ELSEWHERE IN THE BASE, HECTOR WALKING.
Which way now?
(IN HIS MIND) Keep walking down the tunnel.
And where does that lead?
(IN HIS MIND) Cease your questions. We will guide you. No, wait! Hide here. A human is approaching!
FX: VONCHEF APPROACHES USING A DETECTOR. HIS RADIO CRACKLES.
(VIA RADIO) Vonchef, come in.
(IN SPACESUIT) (FX: HE HALTS TO ANSWER RADIO) What is it?
(VIA RADIO) Any sign of our third intruder?
(IN SPACESUIT) Not yet, but they’re somewhere in this section. What about you?
(VIA RADIO) We picked up the other two, a human and a humanoid, I sent them back to the shuttle with Root.
(IN SPACESUIT) What are they? Non-aggressive?
(VIA RADIO) Yes, a couple of scavengers by the look of them. But one of them’s a living S P carrier.
(IN SPACESUIT) Kilbracken will be pleased.
(VIA RADIO) Not sure that’s in her emotional repertoire. Let me know when you’ve located the intruder. Heading back to the airlock now.
(IN SPACESUIT) Very good, Leader. (FX: RADIO OFF)
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 22
15. INT. ISOLATION ROOM.
FX: DOOR HISSES OPEN.
In here.
FX: THEY ENTER, DOOR HISSES SHUT BEHIND THEM.
Woah, bare white walls and two beds. You really know how to put the hospital into hospitality - (LOSES BALANCE) Could do with a
lie down though, now you mention it.
Careful, Ace, take it easy.
(FX: SITTING ON BED) I’m alright, just a bit dizzy.
As you can see through your security camera, we’ve co-operated. What do you want us to do?
(VIA INTERCOM) You can start by telling us who are you and what you were doing in Titan base.
I’m the Doctor, this is Ace, and we landed there by accident.
(VIA INTERCOM) By accident?
A navigation fault. Our communications were also damaged so we didn’t hear the warning.
(VIA INTERCOM) You have had a run of bad luck, haven’t you? What about the third member of your party?
What third member?
(VIA INTERCOM) Don’t pretend you don’t know, he appeared a few minutes after you.
Hector! He must’ve got out of the TARDIS.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 23
I must’ve underestimated him. Or the virus within him. Listen to me I-don’t-know-what-your-name-is —
(VIA INTERCOM) Research Team Leader Shafira.
Listen to me, Leader Shafira. Our friend is ill, not with Saturnian Plague, but something far more dangerous.
(VIA INTERCOM) More dangerous?
You have no idea. Do you have any more crew in the base?
(VIA INTERCOM) One more, Biotech Vonchef. I sent him to bring your friend in.
Then you must warn him not to approach Hector. He must not go anywhere near him!
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 24
16. INT. TUNNEL.
FX: VONCHEF IN SPACESUIT, SENSOR BLEEPING.
(IN SPACESUIT) You might as well come out, I know you’re here.
(IN HECTOR’S MIND) Now! Grab the human!
QUIET) Contact must be made. (DIVES WITH YELL, GRAB, STRUGGLE
(IN SPACESUIT) Hey, get off, get off me!
(IN HECTOR’S MIND) Remove his helmet! Release the seal!
FX: HECTOR REMOVES VONCHEF’S HELMET. HYDRAULIC HISS.
You stupid vagrant, do you have any idea what you’ve done? This whole base is contaminated!
FX: VIRUS CRACKLE
(SLIGHT VIRUS VOICE-EFFECT ) Contact has been made.
FX: HIS RADIO ACTIVATES.
(VIA RADIO) Vonchef! (BEAT) Vonchef!
Answer.
(VOICE BACK TO NORMAL) (ANSWERING) Vonchef speaking.
(VIA RADIO)
Listen to me, I’ve just been informed the person you’re looking for has some sort of disease and must not be approached under any circumstances.
I understand. What do you wish me to do?
(VIA RADIO) Just return to the shuttle ASAP.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 25
I understand.
FX: RADIO OFF.
I will accompany you. We must take control of the shuttle.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 26
17. INT. ISOLATION ROOM.
But if Hector’s out there, won’t he catch this... Saturnian plague too?
No. The virus in his system will obliterate any competition.
(WEAKENING FROM NOW ON) A virus fighting off a virus?
It’s alright. Conserve your strength. (ADDRESSING MONITOR) Shafira. When can my companion receive treatment?
(VIA INTERCOM)
Once Vonchef’s back on board we’ll head to the Centre for Alien Biomorphology, it’s the only place with the necessary facilities.
The Centre for Alien Biomorphology. Of course. It’s retracing its steps.
What?
But the journey will take hours... Ace might not last that long. She’s already developing a fever.
(VIA INTERCOM) It’s alright, Root’s preparing a cryogenic unit now.
You intend to freeze her?
(VIA INTERCOM) Best way of keeping her alive and preventing the spread of the infection.
Stick me in cold storage?
(VIA INTERCOM) Do you have any objection, Doctor?
I don’t see that we have any alternative.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 27
18. INT. SPACESHIP HOLD.
FX: ROOT PREPARING FREEZER CABINET.
(VIA INTERCOM) Biotech Root, how’s the cryo-unit coming along?
Ready in one more minute, just programming the thermostat...
(VIA INTERCOM) Let me know when it’s ready.
FX: INTERCOM OFF. DOOR OPENS.
Ah, Vonchef, I was wondering where you’d got to, I could do
with some help —
(VIA SPACESUIT) Yes. (FX: REMOVES HELMET) I will help you.
(TERRIFIED) Your eyes... what’s happened to your eyes?
FX: VIRUS CRACKLE.
(SLIGHT VIRUS VOICE-EFFECT FROM NOW ON) Contact has been made.
FX: BUTTON PRESSED, DOOR OPENS. HECTOR ENTERS.
(SLIGHT VIRUS VOICE-EFFECT FROM NOW ON) The human Root has joined the swarm.
Are there any more humans in this craft?
One more — Research Team Leader Shafira.
Then she must join us.
(VIA RADIO) Any chance you could hurry up with that unit? Our carrier’s not going to last much longer.
But first our genesis must proceed. The life of the female must be preserved. She must be conveyed to the Bi-Al foundation.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 28
I understand. (ANSWERS INTERCOM, VOICE BACK TO NORMAL) The cryo-unit is prepared.
(VIA INTERCOM) About time. Wheel it into the isolation room.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 29
19. ISOLATION ROOM.
(VIA INTERCOM) Doctor, Medtech Root’s coming in with the cabinet now.
FX: DOOR OPENS, CABINET WHEELED IN, DOOR CLOSES.
(VIA SPACESUIT) Please move out of the way.
Great, I get to find out what it’s like to be sleeping beauty.
(VIA SPACESUIT) The female must be placed in the cryo-unit.
FX: CRYO-UNIT OPENED, LIKE A FREEZER.
Give me a sec to get up — (TOO WEAK)
It’s alright, Ace, I’m going to lift you, one, two — (LIFTS)
LIFTED
(VIA SPACESUIT) Place the female in the cabinet.
FX: ACE IS PLACED IN THE CABINET.
ACE:
PUTS ACE DOWN) (BEING PUT DOWN
Woah, it’s well chilly in here.
You'll feel a little cold at first, but then you’1l go to sleep, and when you wake up it’1l only seem a few seconds later.
No chance of a hot water bottle then.
(VIA SPACESUIT) Move away from the cabinet. It must be sealed.
Just relax and everything will be fine.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 30
(LOSING CONSCIOUSNESS) ... find out what it feels like... to be a lemon popsicle. (ASLEEP)
FX: CABINET CLOSED. BUTTONS PRESSED.
(VIA SPACESUIT) Commencing cryogenic preservation... Subject heart rate
dropping. She has now entered a state of suspended animation.
Sleep well, Ace.
(VIA SPACESUIT) She must be placed in the storage hold.
FX: DOOR OPENS, CABINET WHEELED OUT, DOOR CLOSES.
(VIA INTERCOM) Don’t worry, Doctor. Your companion is quite safe. We know what we're doing.
I wish I could be sure of that.
(VIA INTERCOM) Why do you think we came to Titan in the first place, Doctor?
What?
(VIA INTERCOM) We’re a scientific research team. We were instructed to find a
living carrier of the plague virus. That’s why we’re here.
And I’ve just given you what you wanted.
FX: CONTINUES INTO NEXT SCENE.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 31
20. INT. SPACESHIP CONTROL ROOM.
We weren’t lying to you, Doctor. Once we get to the Bi-Al foundation, she will undergo curative treatment.
(VIA INTERCOM) But first you need her for something else.
The morphological structure of the virus changes after the death of the host. Which is why we’re so keen to keep your companion alive...
(VIA INTERCOM) I see. You know I’m not an infection risk. Any chance of letting me out of here?
In a moment, once we’re in flight. I recommend you strap yourself in.
FX: INTERCOM SETTINGS CHANGED.
Vonchef, where are you?
(NORMAL VOICE, VIA INTERCOM) I am on board and making my way up to the bridge, Leader.
At last, thought we were going to have to leave you behind. Get ready for launch.
FX: INTERCOM OFF. BUTTONS PRESSED.
Detaching from base airlock. Activating ascent platform.
FX: DEEP, JUDDERING RUMBLE AS SHIP IS RAISED BY A LIFT. DOOR
OPENS.
Well don’t just stand there, Vonchef, I need you to co-pilot this thing. And take that helmet off.
(VIA SPACESUIT) As you wish.
FX: SPACE HELMET REMOVED.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM
(SLIGHT VIRUS VOICE-EFFECT FROM NOW ON) Now you must join us.
What the hell — you’ve got it, you’ve got the — (plague)
FX: VIRUS CRACKLE.
(SLIGHT VIRUS VOICE-EFFECT FROM NOW ON) Contact has been made.
FX: DOOR OPENS, ROOT ENTERS.
(SLIGHT VIRUS VOICE-EFFECT FROM NOW ON) All the humans in this craft have now joined the swarm.
Then it is time to return to the Bi-Al Foundation.
FX: ASCENT PLATFORM STOPS.
Shuttle now on moon surface. Commencing launch.
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED, RUMBLE AND SPACESHIP TAKES OFF.
Page 32
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 33
21. INT. ISOLATION ROOM.
FX: RUMBLING CEASES AS SPACESHIP IN FLIGHT.
Well, Shafira? Are you going to let me out of here or not? (BEAT) Oh well... I suppose I’1l have to find some way of
passing the time.
FX: HE PLAYS THE SPOONS, THEN STOPS AS THE DOOR OPENS.
Doctor.
Hector! What are you doing here?
I sneaked on board the shuttle before take-off and came to release you.
You don’t have to keep up the act for my benefit. I know you’re not Hector.
(SLIGHT VIRUS VOICE-EFFECT FROM NOW ON) You know who I am?

SHAFIRA: Detaching from base airlock. Activating ascent platform.
SHAFIRA: OPENS.
SHAFIRA: Well don’t just stand there, Vonchef, I need you to co-pilot this thing. And take that helmet off.

DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM
VONCHEF: (SLIGHT VIRUS VOICE-EFFECT FROM NOW ON) Now you must join us.

SHAFIRA: (SLIGHT VIRUS VOICE-EFFECT FROM NOW ON) Contact has been made.
ROOT: (SLIGHT VIRUS VOICE-EFFECT FROM NOW ON) All the humans in this craft have now joined the swarm.
VONCHEF: Then it is time to return to the Bi-Al Foundation.
SHAFIRA: Shuttle now on moon surface. Commencing launch.
SHAFIRA: Page 32
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 33
DOCTOR: Well, Shafira? Are you going to let me out of here or not? (BEAT) Oh well... I suppose I’1l have to find some way of
DOCTOR: passing the time.
HECTOR: Doctor.
DOCTOR: Hector! What are you doing here?
HECTOR: I sneaked on board the shuttle before take-off and came to release you.
DOCTOR: You don’t have to keep up the act for my benefit. I know you’re not Hector.
HECTOR: (SLIGHT VIRUS VOICE-EFFECT FROM NOW ON) You know who I am?
DOCTOR: I assume I’m addressing the swarm. You possessed him and made him land the TARDIS on Titan. And I’ve a pretty good idea why.
HECTOR: Why?
CONTINUE: INTO NEXT SCENE.
DOCTOR: Because you’re not a naturally-occurring organism, are you? You were the product of genetic modification! Someone took the Saturnian plague and altered it to create you. That’s why you chose this point in time. You want to revisit your own birth!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 34
VONCHEF: The Doctor has deduced the nature of our plan.
ROOT: It’s of no consequence. He cannot prevent what he knows must come to pass.
SHAFIRA: Course programmed for Bi-Al foundation, asteroid k-4-0-6-7. Arrival time one hour. Now approaching asteroid belt.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 35
HECTOR: (VIA INTERCOM AS WE MOVE BACK FROM CONTROL ROOM) Congratulations, Doctor. You are correct. The passage of time has not dimmed your intelligence.
DOCTOR: So you want to change what happened? No. You daren’t interfere with the course of events, in case you wipe yourself out of existence.
HECTOR: Nothing must threaten the moment of genesis.
DOCTOR: Of course, that’s what Ace is for. You need to ensure that history continues on track. She’s carrying the plague from which you will be created! You need her to reach the Bi-Al foundation because that’s where it’s all due to kick off.
HECTOR: It is where the swarm first achieved sentience. The most glorious moment in the history of the universe!
DOCTOR: I’d forgotten your tendency for self-aggrandisement. So how did it happen? Are you the product of someone deliberately altering the nature of the virus, or the product of an unhappy accident?
HECTOR: (VIA INTERCOM AS WE MOVE BACK TO CONTROL ROOM) You will find out soon enough, Doctor. The hour draws near.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 36
VONCHEF: Warning! Uncharted asteroid detected directly ahead!
SHAFIRA: Emergency evasive action. Altering trajectory -
ROOT: It is too late, it is too close!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 37
DOCTOR: & HECTOR:
DOCTOR: (BOTH REACTING TO BEING HURLED OFF THEIR FEET AS SHIP SWERVES
ALL: OVER THE SHOP)
DOCTOR: Whoopsi-daisy!
HECTOR: (KNOCKED OVER) You will regret this!
DOCTOR: Sorry, must dash, bye-bye!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 38
SHAFIRA: Course corrected. Superficial damage to external structure
SHAFIRA: only.
HECTOR: (VIA INTERCOM) (RECOVERING) The Doctor has escaped from the isolation room!
SHAFIRA: He is unpredictable and dangerous. He must be caught at once.
VONCHEF: (GETTING UP) I will search the storage hold.
ROOT: (GETTING UP) I will search the crew quarters.
HECTOR: (VIA INTERCOM) And I will search the engine room.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 39
HECTOR: Doctor! You may as well surrender. It is futile to resist the power of the swarm!
DOCTOR: I wouldn’t be so sure of that.
DOCTOR: And I strongly recommend you don’t fire that thing, because, as you can see, I’ve wrapped myself in one of the fuel cables. Shoot me and this whole engine room will go up!
HECTOR: Then I shall just have to use more direct methods.
HECTOR: (KNOCKED OVER) What... what are you doing?
DOCTOR: I’ve over-ridden the shuttle’s guidance system. Now I’m the one in the driving seat! Woah-oh!
DOCTOR: (HANGING ON) Whoops! Afraid I’m not a very careful driver.
HECTOR: (GETTING UP) Stop. Leave those controls alone!
DOCTOR: Or what? You’1ll kill me? But then you’1l never be able to unlock the exciting new course I’ve just programmed in.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 40
SHAFIRA: The Doctor is telling the truth. The bridge controls no longer respond. The shuttle has altered its trajectory, and is accelerating rapidly...
SHAFIRA: We are now on a collision course with asteroid two-Pallas. Time to impact: four minutes!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 41
HECTOR: You’ve locked the shuttle on a collision course! You’ve condemned us all to death!
DOCTOR: Now you’1ll never get to the Bi-Al Foundation, and nor will the sample of the Saturnian plague!
HECTOR: You intend to prevent the genesis of the swarm!
DOCTOR: I certainly do. Unless you release Hector from your control right now, we all die together - and you will cease ever to have existed!
HECTOR: This is a bluff. You would not dare!
DOCTOR: Try me.
DOCTOR: END OF PART ONE
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 42

elements.text: PART TWO
30. INT. ENGINE ROOM.
BEGINS WITH REPRISE OF SCENE 29
You intend to prevent the genesis of the swarm!
I certainly do. Unless you release Hector from your control right now, we all die together - and you will cease ever to have existed!
This is a bluff. You would not dare!
Try me.
Doctor. You forget. I have occupied your mind. I know what you are. A Time Lord.
Then you’1l know I mean business.
I know you would never tamper with the established course of events.
You're working from an out-of-date biography. I’ve changed.
Enough to become a killer? I can read the mind of this human. He doesn’t trust you, but knows you are not capable of murder.
He barely knows me, so he’s of no use to you. Let him go, while you still can.
And leave you in control of this shuttle? No. Either you surrender —
FX: GUN POWERS UP.
Or I will make each possessed human in this shuttle kill themselves.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 43
What?
You have five seconds before I shoot myself. Four. Three...
Alright, alright! Stop. I surrender.
Then remove your lock on the flight computer.
FX: DOCTOR PRESSES BUTTONS.
It’s done.

FX: BUTTONS PRESSED.
Bridge controls responding. Conducting emergency manoeuvre to avoid collision.

Now, Doctor, remove the fuel cables from your person.

Almost. I think you require a demonstration of our powers. (FX:
ON.) Calling the bridge.
FX: WE MOVE TO OTHER END OF COMMUNICATION.

33. INT. SPACESHIP CONTROL ROOM. (CONTINUOUS
(VIA MONITOR) You’ve made your point, you don’t have to do this!
(VIA MONITOR) Watch the visiphone!
Doctor. This human is not required.

All I have to do is to place the gun against my head and —
FX: GUN FIRES, VONCHEF’S BODY SLUMPS TO THE GROUND.
(VIA MONITOR) There was no need for that.
FX: MOVE TO OTHER END OF CONVERSATION.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 47
34. INT. ENGINE ROOM (CONTINUOUS
Now you know what will happen if you make any further attempts to interfere.
Why not just kill me? What do you need me for?
Your intelligence may be useful. You possess knowledge of time travel.
Then why don’t you take me over?
You retain an immunity factor. Antibodies in your system from your previous infection.
Must be very frustrating for you, to have someone beyond your control.
On the contrary, we have your complete obedience. Or do you require another demonstration?
FX: GUN POWERS UP.
No, that won’t be necessary.
Then you will return with me to the isolation room. Forward.
FX: BUTTON PRESSED, DOOR OPENS.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 48
35. INT. SPACESHIP CONTROL ROOM.
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED.
Shuttle now approaching asteroid K-4-0-6-7.
The crucible of the swarm!
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED.
(NORMAL VOICE) This is shuttle J-fourteen calling Bi-Al Foundation requesting docking clearance.
(VIA INTERCOM) Please state manifest.
Research Team Leader Shafira, Biotech Root, and three spaceniks. One is a living carrier of Saturnian plague, acquired at the behest of Professor Kilbracken.
(VIA INTERCOM) Permission to dock granted. Proceed to docking bay on level 2- X. All sterilisation protocols must be observed.
Understood.
FX: BUTTONS PRESSES, RADIO OFF.
(VIRUS VOICE EFFECT)
We must transfer the cryo-unit to Kilbracken’s laboratory. While our appearance remains unchanged we will not arouse suspicion.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 49
36. INT. ISOLATION ROOM.
FX: SHUTTLE DOCKING, ENGINES POWER DOWN, CLAMPS CLANG! INTO

We've docked. Give me a moment to get my coat and hat —
No, Doctor. You and I will remain here. Nothing must threaten the moment of genesis.
But it would be an honour to be present at such an historic occasion. I could take photographs, immortalize it for posterity -
FX: DOCTOR GETS UP, HECTOR POWERS UP GUN.
Attempt to leave, Doctor — and I will kill myself.
What? But then I’1l definitely be able to leave.
And your companion Hector will definitely be dead.
Ah, yes. Good point, well made.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 50
37. INT. HOSPITAL RECEPTION.
FX: RECEPTION AREA OF FUTURISTIC LABORATORY, BUSTLE OF
BUSINESS, SOOTHING MUZAK. DOOR OPENS, CRYO-UNIT IS WHEELED IN.
Welcome to the Bi-Al Foundation. Please identify.
(NORMAL VOICE) Research Team Leader Martel Shafira.
(NORMAL VOICE) Biotech Belina Root.
FX: KEYBOARD TAPPETY-TAP.
Ah, yes, the Professor is expecting you. This is the carrier, I

38. INT. ISOLATION ROOM.
What exactly does the swarm want?
To ensure our own creation. The most glorious moment -
“- in the history of the universe”, yes. No, there’s more to it than that.
We shall forge a new destiny, and breed, multiply and conquer.
A new destiny? But you can’t do that without a nucleus to lead you, a queen bee to rule the hive.
The nucleus of the swarm must be reborn!
Reborn? Interesting. And I’1l tell you something else that’s interesting.
What?
When you were resurrected you had half your psyche removed, leaving you susceptible to domination.
That is why I was the first to be chosen to join the new swarm.
It saw a gap and jumped straight in. But that weakness also means you should be highly receptive to hypnotic suggestion. Look into my eyes, Hector.
FX: DOCTOR USING HYPNOTISM, AS IN ‘BATTLEFIELD’.
What? What are you — (GROWING TIRED) What are you —
That’s it. You’re suddenly feeling very sleepy... (FX:
ECHO ON LAST FEW WORDS)
REVENGE OF THE SWARM
39. INT. LABORATORY.
FX: HUM OF HI-TECH EQUIPMENT,
Page 52
WHEELED IN.
‘THE
ENEMY’. DOOR OPENS,
Professor Kilbracken?
Ah, there you are. Well done, the young chap, Vonchef?
Shafira, Root, well done. Where’s
There was an accident, at Titan Base.
He was killed. It was quick.
Send my condolences to his family. But you were successful, you acquired a living carrier?
We did.
FX: WIPES MIST OFF OF GLASS.
Who is she? One of the crew?
The crew were dead by the time we arrived. None of them made it to the cryogenic section. She is a vagrant we discovered there.

FX: BUTTONS PRESSED, READINGS TAKEN.
She’s lucky you placed her in cryo-sleep before the disease had a chance to progress.
She agreed to come on the understanding she would be cured.
And she will, or at least, I’1l do my best. Alright, place the cryo-unit in isolation, and commence the revival procedure.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 53
Yes, Professor.
FX: DOOR TO ISOLATION CHAMBER OPENED, UNIT WHEELED IN.
And then return to your duties, I’m sure you have lots to be
getting on with.
We would like to remain here, Professor.
FX: SHAFIRA EMERGES FROM ISOLATION CHAMBER, DOOR CLOSED.
We have no other tasks to attend to.
If you insist, very well. If you want to make yourselves useful, you could start by making me a cup of tea...
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 54
40. INT. ISOLATION ROOM.
(WAKES WITH A START) Where am I? Doctor?
It’s alright, Hector You’re safe.
Really?
Well, no, not remotely, but let’s put that to one side for now. What’s the last thing you remember?
I remember... I was in the TARDIS, and I pressed the button to open the window... then I must’ve fallen asleep. What happened
while I was out?

41. INT. LABORATORY.
FX: HYDRAULIC HISS AS CRYOGENIC UNIT OPENS.
(GROGGY) Wow, you were right about it only seeming few seconds. Doctor? Hey, where am I? Who are you?
(VIA GLASS PARTITION) My name is Professor Oksana Kilbracken. Don’t worry, I’m going to take good care of you.
Where’s the Doctor?
I can assure you I ama fully qualified Doctor of biotechnology and nanomedicine. You couldn’t be in more capable hands.
Not a Doctor, the Doctor, my friend, little guy — (WEAKENS)
Don’t over-exert yourself, you’re still suffering the effects of the Saturnian plague.
The plague... You’re gonna cure me, right?
In order the synthesize the appropriate antibodies I’1ll need a sample of the virus, which means taking a sample of your blood.

FX: BRIEF GENTLE HISS.
How can you be so sure?
Because I’ve just done it. Now lie back and take it easy.
I’ll take it easy when you tell me where the Doctor is. Hey — those two woman behind you, they were in the moonbase.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM
(VIA GLASS PARTITION) Yes, Ace. We brought you here.
So where’s the Doctor? He wouldn’t leave me -
He’s safe on board the shuttle, with your friend Hector.
With Hector? Hang on, there’s something going on here... something... why am I so tired... (LOSING CONSCIOUSNESS )
Page 56
There’s a mild tranquilizing agent in the air in the isolation
chamber. Just relax, and try and get some rest.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 57
42. INT. ISOLATION ROOM.
So this virus thing chose me, because my head’s half-empty?
Yes. The result of all of the memories that made you Hex being deducted.
Deducted? What, like surgically removed?
Removed and placed in a vessel for safekeeping.
Oh, great. So you can stick them back in my head whenever you like, and I’1ll be Hex again?
Not quite. The vessel was destroyed. And all of your — all of Hex’s — memories with it.
So I can never get them back?
Would you want to?
Would’ve been nice to have had the choice, I suppose. But you can’t miss what you don’t remember, can you?
Don’t you want to know who you really are?
I’m alright being who I am. I’m sure Hex was a great guy and I know I’1l never measure up to him in Ace’s eyes, but as far as I’m concerned he’s dead and gone and I’m here to stay.
Yes. You’re Hector forever — and Hex is gone forever.
So taking that all as read, where exactly are we?
You’re on board a shuttle docked at a medical institute in the asteroid belt in the year 4920.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 58
And where’s Ace?
Somewhere in the institute. Let’s go and find her, shall we?
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 59
43. INT. LABORATORY.
FX: KILBRACKEN OPERATING SUPER-MICROSCOPE MACHINE.
Datalysation complete. The virus is intact! Commencing cellular augmentation.
FX: MACHINE WHIRRS INTO FUTURISTIC LIFE.
I have brought you your tea. (FX: HANDS OVER CUP) What are you hoping to achieve?
(SIPS) It’s quite simple. The Saturnian virus is so powerful no other pathogens can survive within the body, it destroys all rivals.
You mean it reigns supreme over all other organisms?
If you like. Now just imagine what we could do if we could modify the Virus to act benignly towards the host. Mankind could travel anywhere in the universe and be impervious to all diseases.
You seek to make the virus the servant of humanity?
A mutually-beneficial symbiosis. In a few decades the human race will be spreading out across the stars, colonising new worlds, and this virus will help them.
Does the virus not have the right to choose its own destiny?
What are you talking about? Don’t be ridiculous, it’s only a virus, after all!

It allows me to modify the virus’ genetic code, through an iterative process of accelerated evolution. It’s currently undergoing twelve thousand years of evolutionary progress every second...
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 60
44. INT. HOSPITAL RECEPTION.
FX: DOCTOR AND HECTOR ENTER THROUGH SLIDING DOORS.
Where do you think they’1ll have taken her?
Not sure. (TO RECEPTIONIST) Hello, I wonder if you can help me.
Welcome to the Bi-Al Foundation. Please identify.

We’re looking for a girl who was brought in, called Ace.
FX: TAPPETY-TAP.
A human of that name is currently undergoing treatment in the Isolation Ward.

(RUMMAGING IN POCKETS) Ah, give me a moment —
We haven’t got any, we just walked in.

(FX: BUTTON PRESSED. ALARM SOUNDS. GLASS PANEL SLIDES DOWN
OFF RECEPTION DESK)
(TANNOY )
Contamination risk in reception area. Security personnel to proceed to level 2-X. Sealing all elevators and stairwells. Repeat. (REPEATS).

FX: HULLABALOO BREAKS OUT, PEOPLE RUSHING ABOUT.
Whoops, guess I shouldn’t have said that.
No. Come on, we can’t hang around here.

There’s another way to level X 4. The service shaft! Come on!
FX: THEY RUN.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 62
45. INT. LABORATORY.
FX: ALARM SOUNDS HERE, COMPUTER TANNOY HEARD IN B/G AT
INTERVALS. THE EVOLUTION MACHINE IS STILL WORKING AWAY.
What’s happening?
(FX: PUTS DOWN TEA) Contamination alert. We have to go to the assembly point.

I’m sorry, there’s no time to argue — or you’1ll give me no choice but to call security. (FX: PREPARES NEEDLE) I’11 meet you there in a few minutes.
You are staying here? What are you doing?
The girl, Ace, I have to give her an injection of the viral antibodies before the infection advances any further.
This cannot wait?
If I wait, she’1ll die. Go. I won’t be long.
We shall wait for you at the assembly point.
FX: ROOT AND SHAFIRA LEAVE, DOOR OPENS, CLOSES. KILBRACKEN
INJECTION.
Alright, Ace... this will either kill you or cure you...
FX: SHE PUTS ON MASK, ENTERS ISOLATION CHAMBER.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 63
46. INT. CORRIDOR.
FX: ALARM QUIETER HERE, NO COMPUTER ANNOUNCEMENTS. NO ONE IS
AS THE DOCTOR AND HECTOR RUN IN.
“Servis ellyvater”! How come no-one can spell in the future?
Never mind the spelling, just get in. We should be able to use it to get to level X 4.
(CLIMBING IN) It’s a bit cramped in here.
(CLIMBING IN) Then you’d better budge up!
FX: DOCTOR STARTS PUSHING BUTTONS.
What are you doing?
Over-riding the security over-ride.
FX: HE SUCCEEDS, SIDE PANEL OF THE SERVICE ELEVATOR CLOSES.
Lt s ¢closings«.
Yes. Hold tight. Up we go!
FX: WARNING BEEP, METAL LOCKING, THEN -— VWOOOSH!
DOCTOR/HECTOR
REACTING TO BEING IN A RAPIDLY ASCENDING DUMB WAITER
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 64
47. INT. LABORATORY.
FX: ALARM AND EVOLUTION MACHINE STILL IN B/G. WE’RE IN THE
CHAMBER.
Well, Ace. How do you feel?
(WAKING) Fine. Like I’ve just had the best lie-in ever. Hey, you’re in here with me, and not wearing a mask.

I’m cured? Completely?

(GETTING UP) Then I can get out of this thing. Hey, can you hear some sort of siren or is that just me?

FX: THEY LEAVE ISOLATION CHAMBER. THE EVOLUTION MACHINE IS

Hey, what’s up with your microwave?

FX: IN B/G, ALARM STOPS, BUT NOT NOTICEABLE.

You mean it’s growing?

FX: BUTTONS PRESSED ON INSTRUMENTS.
What is that, a microscope?
A very powerful one. Now. Let me see... there, that must be the nucleus. (GASPS) Oh my...
What is it?

What did you see?

What, a little germ? Sounds cool. Let’s have a butcher's.

Destroyed?

FX: DOOR OPENS, STAGE RIGHT. SHAFIRA AND ROOT ENTER.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 66
(VIRUS VOICE EFFECT FROM NOW ON) No. The virus must not be harmed!
(VIRUS VOICE EFFECT FROM NOW ON) Step away from the machine. (FX: LASER GUN, EXPLOSION ON FAR SIDE OF LAB) Or we will kill you. This is your final warning.

(WHISPER) What on Earth... what’s happened to them?
(WHISPER) Their faces, they’re infected...
(WHISPER) Saturnian plague?
No, something else. Get away, Ace. The emergency exit.
What about you?
I don’t run from the sick, I treat them, that’s my job. Now go!
If you say so -
FX: ACE LEAVES (LEFT). LASER GUN IS FIRED, MISSES, EXPLOSION.
The girl Ace has escaped.
It is of no consequence. We have the Professor.
What do you want with me?
You are our creator. You are the one who gave us life.
What are you talking about?
& ROOT: We are the swarm!
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 67
The swarm? You mean, you’re infected by, controlled by —
& ROOT: The virus you genetically engineered.
-.. contained in this machine.
But that’s impossible, I only just conducted the experiment —
The swarm has travelled back through time in order to forge a new destiny.
