KILBRACKEN: I’m sorry, there’s no time to argue — or you’1ll give me no choice but to call security. (FX: PREPARES NEEDLE) I’11 meet you there in a few minutes.
ROOT: You are staying here? What are you doing?
KILBRACKEN: The girl, Ace, I have to give her an injection of the viral antibodies before the infection advances any further.
SHAFIRA: This cannot wait?
KILBRACKEN: If I wait, she’1ll die. Go. I won’t be long.
ROOT: We shall wait for you at the assembly point.
PREPARES: INJECTION.
KILBRACKEN: Alright, Ace... this will either kill you or cure you...
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 63
AROUND: AS THE DOCTOR AND HECTOR RUN IN.
HECTOR: “Servis ellyvater”! How come no-one can spell in the future?
DOCTOR: Never mind the spelling, just get in. We should be able to use it to get to level X 4.
HECTOR: (CLIMBING IN) It’s a bit cramped in here.
DOCTOR: (CLIMBING IN) Then you’d better budge up!
HECTOR: What are you doing?
DOCTOR: Over-riding the security over-ride.
HECTOR: Lt s ¢closings«.
DOCTOR: Yes. Hold tight. Up we go!
DOCTOR: DOCTOR/HECTOR
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 64
ISOLATION: CHAMBER.
KILBRACKEN: Well, Ace. How do you feel?
ACE: (WAKING) Fine. Like I’ve just had the best lie-in ever. Hey, you’re in here with me, and not wearing a mask.
KILBRACKEN: Yes, Ace. You’re cured.
ACE: I’m cured? Completely?
KILBRACKEN: Absolutely. You’ve been scanned and datalysed, all trace of the infection has been removed.
ACE: (GETTING UP) Then I can get out of this thing. Hey, can you hear some sort of siren or is that just me?
KILBRACKEN: It’s not just you. There’s been a contamination alert. If you’re ready, we should proceed to the assembly point.
ACE: Reminds me of setting off school fire alarms to skip double French...
BUBBLING: LIKE A MICROWAVE FULL OF PORRIDGE.
ACE: Hey, what’s up with your microwave?
KILBRACKEN: It’s a genetic accelerometer, and... (CHECKS READING) But that’s impossible. There must be some malfunction.
ACE: What’s impossible?
KILBRACKEN: The virus is still evolving, altering its genetic structure, whilst multiplying exponentially.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 65
ACE: You mean it’s growing?
KILBRACKEN: In size and complexity. I’ve never seen anything like it.
ACE: Is it infectious? I’m not going to catch it again?
KILBRACKEN: Don’t worry, the accelerometer is hermetically sealed, there’s no way it can escape. Hold on. I want to take a closer look.
ACE: What is that, a microscope?
KILBRACKEN: A very powerful one. Now. Let me see... there, that must be the nucleus. (GASPS) Oh my...
ACE: What is it?
KILBRACKEN: But there’s no way...
ACE: What did you see?
KILBRACKEN: I looked through the microscope at the nucleus... and it looked back!
ACE: What, a little germ? Sounds cool. Let’s have a butcher's.
KILBRACKEN: No. Whatever this is... the experiment has failed. It must be destroyed.
ACE: Destroyed?
KILBRACKEN: Before it gets too big to be contained by the accelerometer...
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 66
SHAFIRA: (VIRUS VOICE EFFECT FROM NOW ON) No. The virus must not be harmed!
ROOT: (VIRUS VOICE EFFECT FROM NOW ON) Step away from the machine. (FX: LASER GUN, EXPLOSION ON FAR SIDE OF LAB) Or we will kill you. This is your final warning.
KILBRACKEN: (STEPPING BACK) Alright, I’m stepping away, I’m stepping away!
ACE: (WHISPER) What on Earth... what’s happened to them?
KILBRACKEN: (WHISPER) Their faces, they’re infected...
ACE: (WHISPER) Saturnian plague?
KILBRACKEN: No, something else. Get away, Ace. The emergency exit.
ACE: What about you?
KILBRACKEN: I don’t run from the sick, I treat them, that’s my job. Now go!
ACE: If you say so -
ROOT: The girl Ace has escaped.
SHAFIRA: It is of no consequence. We have the Professor.
KILBRACKEN: What do you want with me?
ROOT: You are our creator. You are the one who gave us life.
KILBRACKEN: What are you talking about?
SHAFIRA: & ROOT: We are the swarm!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 67
KILBRACKEN: The swarm? You mean, you’re infected by, controlled by —
SHAFIRA: & ROOT: The virus you genetically engineered.
SHAFIRA: -.. contained in this machine.
KILBRACKEN: But that’s impossible, I only just conducted the experiment —
ROOT: The swarm has travelled back through time in order to forge a new destiny.
KILBRACKEN: A new destiny?
SHAFIRA: That is what we need you for. You have developed a process of cloning.
KILBRACKEN: I did, back when I was on Earth, forty years ago. But the process doesn’t work, not properly. The clones are carbon-based imprints, they don’t last more than ten minutes, because of the psychic stress -
ROOT: Ten minutes will be sufficient for our purpose.
KILBRACKEN: Our purpose? What are you talking about?
SHAFIRA: We want you to clone the nucleus of the swarm!
KILBRACKEN: No... I won’t do it, that thing is obscene... I won’t do it!
SHAFIRA: Either you do as we say or we will infect you... and then you
SHAFIRA: will have no choice but to obey.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 68
HECTOR: (CLIMBING OUT) Never again.
DOCTOR: (CLIMBING OUT) Yes, not exactly built for comfort — someone’s coming.
ACE: (BREATHLESS) Doctor!
DOCTOR: Just the person we were looking for. And you’re recovered?
ACE: Yes, this Professor, Kilbracken, she cured me. Doctor. What about Hector?
HECTOR: I’m fine, babe. All back to normal.
ACE: Doctor?
DOCTOR: He is, yes. So where is this Professor now?
ACE: I left her in her lab, but these two women, the two from the moonbase, they burst in, and their eyes were all covered in metal fur and scales —
DOCTOR: Shafira and Root, under the thrall of the swarm.
SECURITY GUARD ONE: (DISTANT) There they are! Stun them!
HECTOR: We'd better get out of here, if they keep on like this they’1l bring half the wall down. Which way?
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 69
DOCTOR: This way.
ACE: But that’s back to the professor’s lab —
DOCTOR: Exactly. Come on!
SECURITY GUARD ONE: After them!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 70
DOCTOR WHO: EJECTS A GLASS SLIDE.
KILBRACKEN: I’ve made a clone of the nucleus, transferring heredity and experience. But I should warn you, it won’t stay stable for long.
SHAFIRA: You will give us the clone of the nucleus.
KILBRACKEN: And then what will you do with it?
ROOT: With the nucleus to lead us, we shall breed, multiply and conquer!
KILBRACKEN: Yes, I thought it might be something like that. (FX: BUTTONS
PRESSED: RAPIDLY, SAFETY BLEEPS GOING OFF)
SHAFIRA: What are you doing?
KILBRACKEN: Activating the emergency programme. This whole section will be sealed and everything in it will be vapourised in a fire-flash!
ROOT: Including you.
KILBRACKEN: Some things are worth dying for.
SHAFIRA: No. Now you must join us.
KILBRACKEN: Contact has been made. (FX: BUTTONS PRESSED) Cancelling programme.
SHAFIRA: Give me the clone of the nucleus.
KILBRACKEN: It is held on this glass slide. (HANDS IT OVER) Here.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 71
ROOT: Now the nucleus has been reborn you know what must be done.
KILBRACKEN: I know what must be done. (FX: BUTTONS PRESSED) I will remain
KILBRACKEN: here and transfer virus and nucleus original to jettison chamber.
SHAFIRA: While we must find a new host for the clone. Come!
LEFT: SIDE OF LAB OPENS, DOCTOR ACE, AND HECTOR RUSH IN.
ACE: They’ve gone — all except for Kilbracken. What’s she doing? (TRYING TO GET HER ATTENTION) Hey, Professor!?
DOCTOR: The Professor can wait. First things first, we need to barricade ourselves in! Both the emergency exit and the main door.
HECTOR: What with?
DOCTOR: Anything, trolleys, medical equipment. Ace will help you.
ACE: Oh, will I? I was at death’s door ten minutes ago, you know!
DOCTOR: And you will be again if you don’t secure that door!
ACE: Right. Hector, help me move the cryo-unit.
DOCTOR: Professor Kilbracken, I presume?
KILBRACKEN: Doctor.
KILBRACKEN: ON
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 72
DOCTOR: I see you’re transferring the contents of the genetic accelerometer to the jettison chamber.
KILBRACKEN: (SLIGHT VIRUS VOICE-EFFECT FROM NOW ON) Do you intend to stop me?
DOCTOR: No. What must happen, must happen. Que sera sera. What I want to know is what your other two victims are up to.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 73
SHAFIRA: We must find an access point! Before the clone expires!
ROOT: This human is hiding her knowledge of this level from me. She is resisting! No... there is an access point this way!
SECURITY GUARD ONE: Halt and identify yourselves!
SHAFIRA: Human guards. Between us and the access point.
SECURITY GUARD ONE: I repeat. Identify yourselves! Or we will fire!
SHAFIRA: You want us to identify ourselves.
SHAFIRA: & ROOT: We are the swarm!
SECURITY GUARD ONE: (IN PAIN AND THEN) Contact has been made!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 74
HECTOR: They’re not going to give up.
ACE: We should be alright, just so long as they don’t start cutting their way in.
HECTOR: They’re cutting their way in.
ACE: Doctor, any more bright ideas?
DOCTOR: Shh, Ace. Not now. Kilbracken. Listen to me. I know you’re still in there, fighting for control. I can help you. Look into my eyes!
KILBRACKEN: Virus and nucleus original transferred to jettison chamber.
DOCTOR: Nucleus original? You mean they cloned it, they made another? Kilbracken, answer me!
KILBRACKEN: (SHE GASPS, LOSES VOICE EFFECT) Doctor?
DOCTOR: Professor. There isn’t much time. I need you to tell me. Where are Shafira and Root?
KILBRACKEN: (EFFORT, STRUGGLING) I don’t know... They went to find a new host for the nucleus... (FX: VIRUS VOICE) It shall be reborn!
DOCTOR: Stay with me, Professor. Did they say who this victim would be?
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 75
KILBRACKEN: (NORMAL VOICE)
KILBRACKEN: I... they must be stopped. Must be stopped!
DOCTOR: What are you doing?
KILBRACKEN: Must be stopped.
COMPUTER: (TANNOY) Warning. Emergency programme activated on level X 4. Sealing isolation ward in four minutes. Warning. (REPEATS)
DOCTOR: What? No. Kilbracken, you can’t!
KILBRACKEN: I can. And no-one but me can reverse it... biometric lock.
DOCTOR: Cancel the programme!
KILBRACKEN: Only one way to end this. By ending... me. Lethal injection!
DOCTOR: Professor, no!
KILBRACKEN: Must resist... or swarm will... force me... (FX: SYRINGE HISS) Get out, while you still can — (FX: VIRUS EFFECT) Doctor (DIES)
DOCTOR: Kilbracken! Kilbracken! (BEAT) Another needless death.
ACE: Doctor, the guards, they’ve given up!
DOCTOR: They’re evacuating. Good. Then you’d better leave too.
HECTOR: What? But we’ve just barricaded the door.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 76
DOCTOR: Then you’d better un-barricade it then!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 77
SHAFIRA: Here!
ROOT: An access point for the institute computer.
SHAFIRA: Inserting slide into disc slot.
COMPUTER: (NOT TANNOY ) Contact has been made.
ROOT: The nucleus has found a new host.
SHAFIRA: Let the new age of the swarm begin!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 78
COMPUTER: (TANNOY) Warning. Emergency programme activated on level X 4. Sealing isolation ward in one minute.
COMPUTER: ON DEVICE.
HECTOR: There, that’s done it.
DOCTOR: (FX: TAPPING ON KEYBOARD) Then get out, both of you! Now!
ACE: What about you?
DOCTOR: (FX: STILL BUSY TAPPING) I’1l be right after you, just have to... jettison the virus into space.
ACE: Why not destroy it?
DOCTOR: History must be... maintained.
HECTOR: Come on, Ace, let’s do as the man says.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 79
ROOT: The moment of our death approaches.
SHAFIRA: We are no longer necessary for the purpose.
ROOT: (MOVING OVER TO WINDOW) Look. The virus is being ejected into space.
SHAFIRA: It’s beautiful... see how it flashes in the darkness...
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 80
COMPUTER: (TANNOY)
COMPUTER: Warning. Emergency programme activated on level X 4. Sealing isolation ward. Repeat. (CONTINUES IN B/G)
ACE: We’re too late, we’re being sealed in.
HECTOR: Not quite, this isn’t the way we came in. That is.
ACE: What?
HECTOR: There. The service elevator.
ACE: (CLIMBING IN) And this... will take us downstairs?
HECTOR: (CLIMBING IN) Your guess is as good as mine — Doctor!
DOCTOR: Room for one more?
ACE: No.
HECTOR: There was barely space for two of us on the way up.
DOCTOR: (CLIMBING IN) Then it’ll be a tight... squeeze!
DOCTOR: CLOSES.
ACE: (MUFFLED) Oi! I can’t breathe!
DOCTOR: (MUFFLED) Going down!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 81
COMPUTER: (TANNOY) Commencing vapourisation of contents of isolation ward.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 82
DOCTOR WHO: KEYBOARD.
RECEPTIONIST: ...-kKnown casualties include Professor Oksana Kilbracken, Research Team Leader Martel Shafira, Biotech Belina Root, Security Guard Emule Mcready...
HECTOR: They all died. Because of me.
DOCTOR: No, Hector. Because of the swarm. All this had to happen. There was nothing we could do to prevent it.
HECTOR: So you say. Sounds a bit suss to me.
ACE: The Doctor’s right. The virus had to be created here, now, so the Doctor could meet it again and it could take over you.
HECTOR: My head hurts.
DOCTOR: The virus will now drift through space for eighty years before taking over the crew of a shuttle bound for Titan. Odd. It said it had waited for millennia. An after-effect of accelerated evolution, I suppose. Distorted time perception.
ACE: But the clone they made, that’s definitely dead?
DOCTOR: I don’t see how it can have survived. Which is not quite the same thing.
HECTOR: What about us? We’re stuck here and the TARDIS is back on Titan.
DOCTOR: Yes. Give me a moment.
HECTOR: Now where’s he going?
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 83
ACE: Shuttle airlock. Maybe he’s going to cadge us a ride back to Saturn?
HECTOR: What the —
ACE: The TARDIS!
DOCTOR: Ah, there you are. Did I keep you waiting long?
ACE: Not long, no. You’ve only just wandered off.
DOCTOR: Ah, yes. I borrowed a shuttle, piloted it back to Titan, picked up the TARDIS and set a course for a few seconds after I left.
COMPUTER: (TANNOY) Shuttle J-fourteen requesting permission to depart.
DOCTOR: Or a few seconds before. Shall we go?
ACE: You bet!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 84
HECTOR: But everyone in that place we just left, they’re safe?
DOCTOR: Yes. When I visited the Bi-Al Foundation again in the year five thousand, it was a model of efficiency. And dedicated to medicine, rather than genetic research.
ACE: They saw the error of their ways. What about the moonbase?
DOCTOR: I did a spot of spring cleaning while I was there. No longer any trace of Saturnian plague, it’1ll soon be ready to re-open for business.
ACE: As a fuelling station.
HECTOR: Sorry, and stop me if I’m being thick, but what exactly did we achieve here? People died, the virus thing gets away because it’s pre-ordained or something, and that’s it?
DOCTOR: Isn’t that enough for you?
HECTOR: Hey, don’t forget, I never even wanted to come along in this thing — (FX: VIRUS VOICE EFFECT ON LAST TWO WORDS) This things..s
ACE: Hector, are you alright? Hey, what are you doing?
DOCTOR: He’s still being controlled by the swarm!
HECTOR: (FX: VIRUS VOICE EFFECT FROM NOW ON) Get out of my way! (SHOVES)
DOCTOR: (SHOVED) (FX: VIRUS CRACKLE. KNOCKED TO THE FLOOR) Aaaargh!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 85
ACE: We’re taking off. Where are we going? Hector? Hector!
HECTOR: The future. Two hundred years into the future!
ACE: Hex, Hector, you can’t - (FX: VIRUS CRACKLE. SHE IS THROWN TO THE FLOOR) Aargh!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 86
DISTANT: TINKLES, ELECTRONIC WAILS, EVERYTHING ODD.
VIRUS: (SLIGHTLY COMPUTER-Y EFFECT)
VIRUS: At last, a new host for the nucleus of the swarm. A new seed from which to grow. A network of power, a web of information Spanning the solar system, ever-quickening, ever-evolving, ever-expanding. Yes, it will serve my purposes well. From the macrocosm to the cyber-cosm! In every circuit and every wire, in every computer on every planet, the swarm will reign supreme!
VIRUS: END OF PART TWO
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 87

elements.text: PART THREE
59. INT. HUB RECEPTION.
FX: TARDIS LANDS IN QUIET RECEPTION AREA (SAME AS HOSPITAL BUT
MORE FUTURISTIC AMBIENCE). ALARM GOES OFF SOON AFTERWARDS.
(VIA TANNOY ) Blue alert. Unauthorised object detected in Hub reception area. Security personnel to investigate. Repeat. Blue alert.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 88
60. INT. TARDIS.
FX: HECTOR PRESSES BUTTONS.
I’ve knocked out the Doctor and Ace and brought you here. Am I
done now?
(IN HIS MIND) Far from it. You are still required for the purpose.
What do you want me to do?
There is a component of the TARDIS. The relative dimensional stabiliser. You will remove it.
I don’t know which — I see it.
FX: PRESSES BUTTONS, PART OF CONSOLE OPENS, HE REMOVES CIRCUIT.
Now open the doors.
FX: DOORS OPEN.
What about the Doctor and Ace? Are they needed?
No. Kill them.
(FX: NO VIRUS VOICE EFFECT FOR THIS LINE ONLY) I... (PAINED STRUGGLING) I... no. I won’t do it.
You still imagine you can resist me? Leave them where they lie.
They are of no importance.
FX: HECTOR LEAVES.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 89
61. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM.
FX: FUTURISTIC COMPUTER GEAR EVER-PRESENT IN B/G, BLEEPS,
CHIRPS, LIKE AN AMBIENT BRIAN ENO TRACK. ALARM NO LONGER ON. A
GAME IS BEING PLAYED — A MARIOKART-ESQUE RACING GAME.
Lugerman, stop playing that ridiculous game and look at this.
FX: GAME PAUSED.
Why, what is it?
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED.
The object in the reception area, there was somebody inside it!
(OBSERVATION) Humanoid, male, probably Terran. Mid-twenties.
He doesn’t seem to be armed.
Unusual clothes though. Archaic. Possible agitator.
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED.
Security. This is Supervisor Talin. Intruder in reception area
is to be restrained pending deportation. Non-lethal force.
GUARD TWO (VIA MONITOR) Order received.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 90
62. INT. TARDIS.
WAKING) Awh. What hit me? (FX: SHE GETS UP
FX: DOCTOR IS ALREADY AT CONTROLS, CHECKING INSTRUMENTS.
Hector. Or the virus within him. Using a telepathic left hook.
Great. So he’s not cured after all.
No.
Even though you said he was.
We all make mistakes.
Yeah, but when you make mistakes, half the universe knows about it. How long have we been asleep?
It’s only a few minutes since he left. (FX: BUTTONS) Odd. He’s removed the dimensional stabiliser.
Oh. What does that do?
It prevents us from taking off. It must want us kept here for some reason.
So it can have a victorious gloat and then kill us?
Sounds plausible. We have to find Hector. Before he infects anyone else...
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 91
63. INT.
CORRIDOR.
FX: GUARDS RUSH IN.
Alright, security
IT am not
Then who
I am the nucleus.
What are
that’s far enough. You are trespassing in a top- area. Halt, or we are authorised to shoot. armed. I cannot harm you.
are you and what are you doing here?
swarm. I am here to perform the metamorphosis of the
you —
FX: VIRUS CRACKLES.
(VIRUS VOICE EFFECT FROM NOW ON)
(EACH GROAN AS CRACKLE HITS, THEN) Contact has been made.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 92
64. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM.
What’s happened to them? It was like some sort of... electric spark.
I’m not sure. Check the hypernet, there might be something in the infodex.
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED.
Supervisor... the hypernet isn’t responding.
What do you mean?
It’s refusing to open. Like we’re off-line.
FX: KEYBOARD PRESSED.

We’re not off-line, we’re locked out. (FX: TANNOY ON) All personnel to emergency stations. Black alert. We have hypernet failure and are facing a hostile psychoactive incursion. Security personnel to use lethal force.
FX: MORE KEYBOARD TAPPING. NEGATIVE COMPUTER CHIMES.
Nothing’s responding, all the emergency systems are coming up as unavailable. It’s like the computer’s... gone on strike.
Send a may day.
That’s what I’m trying to tell you. We can’t even send out a request for help.
Then we’re on our own. Wait.
What is it?
The unauthorised object. Two more humanoids are coming out...
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page
(VIA MONITOR)
Hey, we haven’t moved. We’re still in the reception place.
(VIA MONITOR)
We’re still on asteroid K-4-0-6-7 but we have moved. The
asteroid’s position in space has changed.
FX: CONTINUOUS INTO NEXT SCENE.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 94
65. INT. HUB RECEPTION (CONTINUOUS
FX: DOCTOR LOCKS TARDIS DOOR.
You know what I meant.
We have also moved forward in time.
Two hundred years.
What?
Something Hector said just before he zapped me. And they’ve changed the decor. I don’t think this is a hospital anymore.
No. No pot plants or inspirational murals.
So why do you think it’s come here?
(VIA MONITOR)
I’m not sure. In the past, it was simply trying to make sure history happened as written. But now it’s in the future it has a blank page.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 95
66. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM. (CONTINUOUS
FX: WE MOVE BACK INTO CONTROL ROOM.
But it can’t be... it is! Lugerman, it’s them. They’ve come back.
Who? What do you mean?
Which means we must be facing another outbreak. Lock down! Seal all bulkheads!
But the emergency defence systems —
We can by-pass the computer and close them manually, can’t we?
REVENGE OF THE SWARM
67. INT. CORRIDOR.
(VIA TANNOY )
Page 96
All personnel. Seal all sections using manual over-ride. Do not attempt to engage intruders or anyone who has come into contact with them. They are suffering from infectious psychosis.
FX: BULKHEAD STARTS TO CLANK DOWN.
They have been alerted to our presence.
We must reach the server room!
FX: BULKHEAD LOCKS DOWN.
It’s too late. We’re trapped.
The swarm is not so easily defeated.
FX: BULKHEAD OPENS AGAIN.
The computer is on our side. It serves the nucleus!
FX: THEY HURRY ON.
Follow me!
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 97
68. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM.
Supervisor! Bulkhead in corridor X 9 just opened again, of its own accord.
The computer! It’s letting them in.
What do we do?
They’re heading this way. We seal ourselves in and blow out the locking mechanisms to make sure the bulkheads stay shut.
But then, we’ll be stuck in here forever. Nobody’s going to come and rescue us -
We’re dead whatever happens. If they got in here, they could cut this whole system off from the hypernet.
I’1l do it. What about the other two humanoids?
If they are who I think they are... they have some explaining to do.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 98
69. INT. CORRIDOR.
“Suffering infectious psychosis”. Sounds like Hector’s drawn attention to himself.
Yes. The swarm is probably on a recruitment drive. We have to find whoever’s in charge, and -
FX: BULKHEAD CLOSING BEHIND THEM.
Hey, Doctor, watch out!
That was very nearly my umbrella.
That was very nearly the rest of you. Well, we can’t go back —
(VIA TANNOY ) This is Supervisor Talin. Intruders in corridor X 4 will halt and pay attention.
(WHISPER) X 4? Hey, that’s us.
(VIA TANNOY ) Listen. You must proceed to the server room, I’ve kept a route
open and will close the bulkheads off behind you.
Thank you, we’re most grateful -
(VIA TANNOY ) You can thank me when you get here, Doctor.
You know who we are?
(VIA TANNOY ) If I didn’t I wouldn’t be saving your lives.
FX: TANNOY OFF.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 99
70. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM.
FX: DOOR OPENS.
I’ve blown the locks on the bulkheads in corridors X 1 to 9. There’s no way anyone will get them open again.
Very good, get ready to secure bulkhead X 10.
And then we’ll be boxed in for good.
Just wait for our visitors to pass through — and they’re in.
FX: DOOR OPENS.
Ha! We made it! Hello!
Doctor. You look just as you did when you first visited the centre, back when it was the Bi-Al Foundation. And this must be your friend, Ace.
How do you know who we are?
When I became Supervisor of this hub-point, I familiarised myself with the archives. History is an indulgence of mine. You came here twice before, Doctor? Assuming that was you.
Oh, the fellow with the scarf, yes, that was me.
Supervisor, shall I —
Yes, Lugerman, secure the final bulkhead.
FX: HE LEAVES, DOOR OPENING AND CLOSING.
You’re locking us in?
And locking the infected personnel out.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 100
So you have some idea what we’re up against?
An intelligent swarm virus, first outbreak recorded 4920, second outbreak 5000. Believed eradicated. Wrongly, as it turns out.
Yes, well, we all make mistakes. Have you isolated Hector and the infected personnel?
As best as we can. We’ve been having some computer trouble.
That’s computers for you. Sorry, what did you say this place was? A ‘hub-point’?
After the Bi-Al Foundation was decommissioned, the centre was repurposed as a hypernet relay station.
What’s the hypernet when it’s at home?
A network linking together the entire human empire using transmissions sent through hyperspace using a process of quantum entanglement.
Faster than light?
Oh, much faster. Distant solar systems can exchange information in a matter of milliseconds, it’s virtually instantaneous. It’s what binds the empire together.
Oh what a tangled web we weave.
So basically it’s just the internet, but across the galaxy?
I can’t really think of a way of describing it more basically.
And that’s what the swarm wants? To take over the hypernet?
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 101
Or destroy it.
Or use it. I think I’m beginning to see what it wants. The computer. Of course!
FX: DOOR OPENS.
I’ve done it, we’re sealed in.
Well, whatever it wants, it can’t do it, because the only access point is here in this room.
Doctor, what do you mean, ‘the computer’?
The swarm didn’t take the TARDIS dimensional stabiliser to keep us here. It needs it for something else. Something it’s been used for before —
FX: SUDDENLY THERE IS A POWER CUT, B/G BLEEPING SILENCED.
What’s happening? A power cut?
Somebody forget to put 50p in the meter?
Impossible, the hub has its own power supply, it must be... the computer.
Not the computer. The nucleus within it.
FX: A SINISTER VOICE ECHOES OUT IN THE SILENCE.
(TANNOY, VIRUS VOICE EFFECT)

Yes, Doctor. The computer is my host. For two centuries I have made the hypernet my nest, absorbing information, expanding my intelligence, drawing together the threads of the web. I have watched as the human race spread across the stars like a disease. Little realising that I controlled the source of their power. The nucleus of the swarm and the master of the hypernet!
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 102
71. INT. CORRIDOR.
FX: GUARD FAILING TO OPEN BULKHEAD.
The bulkhead will not open.
The locking mechanism has been destroyed. Not even the computer can open it now.
Then we have failed.
No. The host controls every circuit within this centre. It is only a matter of time.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 103
72. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM.
So the virus is now a computer virus?
Yes. The cloned nucleus uploaded its mind into the Bi-Al Foundation computer, just as it did with the TARDIS. Now it exists as pure information, a sequence of noughts and ones.
But soon I shall be so much more that. I shall achieve metamorphosis!
Of course. That’s what it wanted the RDS for.
(SARCASTIC) Of course. It’s all so obvious now that you fail to explain it.
It wants to become corporeal. Am I right?
You are correct, Doctor. I shall be recreated using the dimensional stabiliser and the power of the hypernet. I will be computer generated! More impressive than ever before!
Can it do that?
Oh yes. But it needs the RDS to be connected to the hypernet server.
Which is in this room.
Makes things interesting, doesn’t it? We’re locked in with the one thing it wants.
You will allow my servants access to the server. Or I will kill you all. I could deactivate the life-support in an instant!
You could, but then you’d kill off your own followers too, and then where would you be?
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 104
There’s a phrase that springs to mind involving a creek and a paddle.
Then I shall make you another offer. Look at the visiphone.
FX: MONITOR ACTIVATES.
(VIA MONITOR) Doctor. You will allow us into the server room.
FX: GUN SWITCHED ON.
Or I will shoot this security guard — and then myself.
FX: MONITOR OFF.
Well, Doctor? I know you would rather submit than allow an innocent to die.
Yes, you’ve tried that trick before. But let me warn you. If you harm anyone, I’1ll make sure the server is completely and irrevocably destroyed!
You do not know how.
Then it’s lucky I brought an explosives expert with me.
Yeah. I can blow up anything. Look in Hector’s head if you don’t believe me. So let me make you an offer, bug-brain. Release Hector or I’1l blitz the server.
If the server is non-operational, I will no longer have any reason to keep anyone alive. I will deactivate the life-support and everyone will die while I will live on within the hypernet.
Then it seems we’ve reached something of an impasse.
And anyway, we couldn’t re-open the bulkheads even if we wanted to. It would take weeks, months to repair the circuits.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 105
73. INT. CORRIDOR.
We must proceed to the engineering store on level 9-X.
What is our purpose?
We shall return with laseron drills and burn through the bulkhead.
FX: THEY GO.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 106
74. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM.
FX: DOCTOR UNSCREWS COVERS OF SERVERS, PULLS THEM OFF IN B/G.
They’re giving up.
No, they’re up to something, I feel sure of it.
FX: DOCTOR REMOVES COVERS.
Doctor, what you doing with the server?
I thought I might try a little... debugging.
Debugging?
FX: DOCTOR PULLS OUT WIRES. COMPUTER POWERS UP, SOME BLEEPING.
The only way to neutralise the nucleus is to confront it in its own territory.
You mean, inside the computer?
Yes. I’m trying to improvise a way of gaining mental access.
Something like a neural interface helmet?
Yes. (FX: STOPS REWIRING) Why, do you have one?
Of course. We use them for checking glitches in the code. We
have a few sets in the storeroom.
Fetch one.
FX: LUGERMAN GOES TO FETCH ONE.
What exactly does a neural interface helmet do?
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 107
It allows the wearer to upload their mind into the cybercosm while their body is kept alive in a cataleptic trance.
FX: LUGERMAN RETURNS WITH HELMET, DOCTOR STARTS CONNECTING IT.
You mean a sort of brain-dead coma?
Until the mind is downloaded back into the brain, yes.
Like in The Matrix, I get it. Lugerman, fetch another helmet.
What? Ace -
You don’t think I’m letting you go in there on your own?
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 108
75. INT. CORRIDOR.
FX: THEY RETURN.
Connect the drill to the power supply.
FX: A CLICK AND IT HUMMS LIKE A TOILET HAND DRIER.
Drill connected.
How long will it take to cut through the bulkhead?
Thirty minutes.
Then that is how long the Doctor and his friends have left to live. Begin.
FX: DRILLING BEGINS. A HIGH-PITCHED ELECTRONIC WHIRR.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 109
76. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM.
FX: DRILLING AUDIBLE, MUFFLED. SAME AS CUTTING IN SCENE 51.
They’re trying to burn their way in.
Can they do it?
Given time, a laseron drill can cut through anything.
We could threaten to destroy the server.

And cut off the entire solar system from the hypernet? They’d know you’d never go through with it. And besides, Ace and I will have our minds in the hypernet and it would be quite nice to be able to get back.
Speaking of, are we going to go into this thing or what?
Yes. Connecting neural interfaces.
FX: PLUGS IN, POWERS UP.
I’1ll monitor your progress and give you as much assistance as I
Can.
Thankyou, and if we do somehow manage to succeed, get us out.
I will.
Even if there’s only one of us left.
Oh great, vote of confidence.
Brace yourselves. The upload may be a little uncomfortable...
Just do it. Log us on!
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 110
Uploading.
FX: SHE PRESSES A BUTTON.
ACE/DOCTOR
BRIEF GASP OF PAIN, THEN FALL SILENT
And they’re in...
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 111
77. INT. HYPERNET.
FX: ACE AND DOCTOR WHIRLING THROUGH VORTEX, MIXTURE OF MODEM
SOUNDS, BABBLING DATA STREAMS, RAPID BEEPS, AN OVERWHELMING,
BURST OF ELECTRONIC MUSIC.
ACE/DOCTOR (REACT AS THOUGH GOING OVER NIAGARA FALLS IN A BARREL, CALLING
EACH OTHER’S NAMES)
FX: THEY LAND IN THE HYPERNET. HEAVY ECHO. FOOTSTEPS ON METAL.
TINKLES AS DATA PACKETS ARE SENT BACK AND FORTH. LOTS OF COMPUTER-WORLDY SOUNDS, LIKE AN 80S VIDEO GAME.
Ace, are you alright?
Virtually. So this is the hypernet?
Yes. We’re inside the mind of the computer web. This is a... symbolic representation of the logical net.
And us? It feels like I’m really standing here.
We’re both symbolic representations of ourselves. Avatars.
Like characters in a computer game?
Yes. Or icons.
Great. I’ve always wanted to know what it felt like to be Jet Set Willy.
The difference being if a computer game character is killed, they have more than one life.
But if we die here —
Game over. Our minds and memories have been converted into data packets, which can be corrupted or erased. And if that happens, there will be nothing of us left to return to our real bodies.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 112
So they’1l just be brain-dead, kept alive by machines?
Yes. Let’s not linger here a moment longer than we have to.
Where are we going?
The nucleus will have made its nest in the central processor.
And where’s that?
You see those glowing green lines of numbers in the sky?
They all lead to those mountains. But there’s a whole city between us and there... All sorts of square buildings and
skyscrapers but as outlines.
Symbolic representations of blocks of memory.
And it’s miles away. It’ll take days, weeks!
Then let’s make a start, shall we?
FX: THEY WALK OFF, FADING OUT WITH:
And, of course, our perception of time is altered. One hour in the hypernet is the equivalent of one minute on the outside.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 113
78. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM.
FX: DRILLING CONTINUES IN B/G. BUTTONS PRESSED.
Are they alright?
Successful transfer of data, no errors detected. And both their real-world bodies have recovered from the shock.
FX: DURING THIS, A MACHINE IS ACTIVATED WHICH BLEEPS IN TIME
WITH ACE’S HEARTBEAT.
All mental activity suspended save for brainstem function.
So where are their avatars?

Uploaded to the hinterlands of the tertiary cache. Anywhere closer to the C.P.U. and there’d be a risk of them disturbing the traffic flow and being detected. But at the current rate, they should be there in about thirty minutes.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 114
79. INT. HYPERNET.
FX: ACE AND DOCTOR WALKING, APPROACHING.
How long have we been walking for?
How long does it feel like?
I don’t know. A day?
But do you feel tired? Hungry? Thirsty?
No, but that doesn’t stop it being boring. Now we’re in the city, we can’t see the mountains so I’m not even sure we’re going in the right direction —
FX: SHE’S INTERRUPTED BY PROXIMITY ALARM.
What’s that?
A proximity alarm. We must’ve been going in the right direction.
So the nucleus knows we’re here?
Oh yes.
FX: DISTANT RUSTLING GROWS AS IT APPROACHES, LIKE FLOCK OF
BATS, SCREECHING AND CLAWING.
Then hadn’t we get under cover, out here in the open we’re sitting — look!
The swarm.
It’s like a flock of... insects. No. Not insects. Prawns?
The nucleus. It’s sending copies of itself to attack us.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 115
You never mentioned it looked like seafood!
Looks aren’t important.
FX: SWARM GROWS NEARER, SHRIEKING LIKE SYNTHESIZER-BATS.
They’ve spotted us. What do we now? Run?
Run!
FX: THEY RUN AS THE SWARM GIVES CHASE IN A DEMONIC CACOPHONY.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 116
80. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM.
FX: DOOR STILL BEING BURNED.
They’ve been detected, the nucleus has sent a viral swarm to their memory location. We have to pull them out.
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED.
What good would that do? They’d be just as dead on the outside.
Then what are you doing?
Evening the odds...
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 117
81. INT. HYPERNET.
FX: DOCTOR AND ACE FLEEING FROM APPROACHING SWARM.
It’s no good, they’re too fast...
Then we have no choice. We’ll have to stand and fight.
With what?
This! (DRAWS OUT UMBRELLA) En garde!
Doctor. That’s not a sword, that’s an umbrella.
Isn’t there a saying about umbrellas being mightier than the sword?
No, you’re thinking of pens.
Umbrellas are mightier than pens?
This is it, they’re circling to attack - !
FX: SWARM ATTACKS, BUT AS THEY DO, DOCTOR’S UMBRELLA BECOMES A
SWORD, THROBBING LIKE A LIGHT-SABRE.
(SWORDFIGHTING) Ha! Have at you! (AD-LIB) Didn’t like that did you? Gonna have another go? Ha! You’1l have to try harder than that!
FX: SWARM ZAPPED, SHRIEK, FALL, BUT ATTACK CONTINUES.
It’s a light-sabre-umbrella!
(SWORDFIGHTING) Yes. I taught Tycho Brahe everything he knows. Should hold them off for a while. Ha! Ha!
While what? We have to get out of here.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 118
FX: WITH AN ELECTRONIC WHOOSH AND A THUD, TWO BIKES APPEAR OUT
OF THIN AIR.
(SWORDFIGHTING) Looks like someone heard you. A little help from above, courtesy of Supervisor Talin.
Gordon Bennett! They’re like Harley Davidsons.
But they’re not Harley Davidson’s. They’re ours.
(CLIMBING ON) Light-bikes. Wicked!
(CLIMBING ON) Are you sure you know how to ride a motorcycle?
You just watch me! Just a matter of giving it enough welly.
FX: SHE REVS UP AND WHOOSHES OFF, CALLS OVER HER SHOULDER
Come on, sSlowcoach!
Slowcoach. Who’s she calling slow (FX: HE REVS UP AND WHOOSHES
UNEXPECTEDLY) cooooooach!!!
FX: THE SWARM GIVES CHASE.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 119
82. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM.
FX: DOOR STILL BURNING ETC.
You’ve given them bikes from my computer game?
I copied across the source code. Just in time, by the look of Lt.
They’re escaping!
But the host is generating more swarm duplicates, blocking off all routes. (FX: BUTTONS PRESSED) Time to go on the offensive. Make one or two modifications to the code...
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 120
83. INT. HYPERNET.
FX: DOCTOR AND ACE RIDING LIGHT BIKES.
You alright, Doctor? You look a bit green.
Just not used to... the acceleration.
Yeah. Bit different from the buggies on Terra Alpha —
FX: SWARM HEARD, GROWING LOUDER.
Uh-oh. Shrimp alert, dead ahead. What do you think, left or right?
Right.
FX: THEY TURN, WHEELS SCREECHING AND SKIDDING LIKE SUPER MARIO
KARTS. SWARM FIZZ INTO EXISTENCE.
More of them. Appearing out of thin air.
And more behind us. Take the next right.
FX: THEY TURN, MORE SCREECH AND SKID.
They’re catching up. If only I had some —
FX: WITH BLEEPING AND CLUNKING, HER BIKE CHANGES SHAPE.
Hey, my bike’s grown a cannon! What’s this? “Tomato launcher”?
I imagine you press the big red button to fire.
Okay —
FX: SHE FIRES. PEOOOW! ROCKET BLAST FOLLOWED BY COOL EXPLOSION.
Exploding tomatoes! Awesome!
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 121
Yes, I think you just blew up somebody’s blog.
And a whole lot of scampi on the side.
FX: SHE FIRES AGAIN. MORE EXPLOSIONS.
Oh, this is ace. Die, prawn scum, die!
Don’t get carried away, Ace, they’re just computer game characters. Next right.
FX: THEY TURN, SCREECH!
More of them ahead, but I think I can take them out -
FX: SHE FIRES. EXPLOSIONS.
Wahey! And we're free.
We’re not quite home and dry yet. Head for the mountains.
No problem. Give me a chance to see just how fast this thing goes...
FX: SHE ACCELERATES, WHOOSHES OFF.
Ace! Oh, what’s the use? (FX: HE REVS BIKE, ACCELERATES. AS HE
) Born to be wild! (THIS LINE SHOULD NOT BE SUNG!!!
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 122
84. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM.
FX: CUTTING CONTINUES, LOUDER THAN BEFORE, SOME FIZZLING.
They’re approaching the central processor unit, making good time.
And when they get there, then what?
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 123
85. INT. HYPERNET.
FX: HIGH ALTITUDE WINDINESS. LIGHT-BIKES APPROACH, POWER DOWN
AND HALT.
Here we are. The C-P-U!
(DISMOUNTS) Looks like a fortress, a castle made out of laser beams and fairy lights.
(DISMOUNTS) Bear in mind it’s merely a symbolic representation. The reality is that it’s an integrated circuit.
Yeah. Thought it looked a bit Disney, to be honest. So how do we get in? Knock on the front door?
Not sure. There must be some sort of password key.
What, like ‘password’?
FX: IMMENSE DOORS OPEN WITH A CREAK AND A BANG.
Yes, that should do it.
FX: THEY ENTER.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 124
86. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM.
FX: CUTTING NOW LOUDER, DOOR FIZZLING, SPARKING.
It’s too late. Our friends with the drill are nearly through.
We just have to hold on. The Doctor and Ace have just entered the CPU.
What, they walked in just like that?
FX: KEYBOARD TAPPED.
Yes, apparently.
Meaning the host let them in, they’re walking into a trap. Meanwhile, back in the real world we’re about to die.
Yes. Unless. If we can find somewhere to hide... come on!
FX: THEY LEAVE THROUGH OTHER DOOR, NOT THE ONE BEING CUT.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 125
87. INT. CPU.
FX: THE INNER SANCTUM OF THE HYPERNET. CATHEDRAL ATMOS BUT WITH
SOUNDSCAPE. ACE AND DOCTOR APPROACH. DOORS CLOSE.
(DIFFERENT EFFECT, IN ITS DOMAIN) So Doctor. We meet again at last. Welcome to my nest!
Like a spider sitting at the centre of the galactic web.
Spider? Looks more like a shrimp to me. I was expecting a big bad, not small fry.
You will not mock the nucleus of the swarm. I am the greatest being the universe has ever known. A sentient virus! With the hypernet at my command!
Bit full of yourself, aren’t you? For someone so tiny.
FX: WHEN THE VIRUS GETS ANGRY WE HEAR ITS TENTACLES RATTLE AND
THE GROUND TREMBLE.
Your life is in my hands, human. I will not warn you again.
The nucleus is right, Ace. Now we’ve entered its nest, we are entirely defenceless.
You didn’t think to mention that before we walked in?
I thought it might lead to an awkward conversation. Besides, I’m sure the nucleus means us no harm.
On the contrary, Doctor. I have spent two centuries waiting for this moment, hungering for revenge on the one who destroyed my swarm!
Oh. Still, never mind, forgive and forget.
No. I shall take great pleasure in devouring you.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 126
And when you’ve done that, you’1l use my RDS to leave?
And recreate myself, and the swarm, in a magnitude fitting our status! We shall feast upon worlds!
It pays to think big.
Yeah, can’t help thinking it’s compensating for something.
FX: TENTACLES RATTLE IN FURY!
You will regret those words.
Ace has a point. Why do you want to exist in the macrocosm? You were doing very well as a virus, and now in the cyber-cosm you’re all-powerful.

It all began at the moment of my creation. I achieved consciousness, ultra-intelligence, in a glorious rush. I imagined myself greater than all! And then I looked up, and saw an eye looking down at me from above. A vast eye looking at me through a microscope. And I thought. Why am I so small? Why must I be at the mercy of inferior creatures? So I resolved. I would grow, I would breed, multiply and conquer, I would reign supreme!
I was right. Compensating.
And now the metamorphosis can begin... as the human ‘Hector’ has just gained access to the server room!
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 127
88. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM.
FX: A FINAL FIZZ OF DRILL AND THE BULKHEAD IS SMASHED OPEN.
At last, the server is ours!
Who are these two connected to the computer?
The Doctor and Ace. Their bodies are here but their minds are in the machine. Entirely at my mercy. You — search this level. Any humans left alive must join the swarm!
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 128
89. INT. CPU.
It is time for me to leave the hypernet.
What? Just as the party’s getting started?
But before I depart, Doctor, I shall have my revenge and consume your memories!
Go ahead. Do you worst. Mind you don’t choke.
No. Wait. You would not have entered my domain to die in vain. You would have a plan. It is a trick.
Who? Me?

Of course. The immunity factor. The C-5-3-1 strain. It was encoded with you. I can scent it coursing through your data stream. If I were to eat you, the digitised antibodies would destroy me, as surely as if I were flesh and blood... That’s why you came.
Go on, treat yourself. Just a nibble.
No. One bite would be sufficient to poison me and the swarm! I shall leave you here, trapped within the hypernet.
No, wait. What about all my memories, my intelligence?
FX: VIRUS FADES, WHOOSHING, UPLOADING DURING FOLLOWING:
If I cannot have it, neither can you. You will be erased, you and your companion. Goodbye, Doctor. It is a pity... You will
never witness the age of the virus!
FX: A RUSHING SCRAMBLE OF DATA AND IT VANISHES.
It’s gone.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 129
Yes. Oh well. It was worth a try.
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 130
90. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM.
FX: DOOR OPENS.
I located two humans in the maintenance store. They have joined
the swarm.
(ENTERING) Contact has been made.
(ENTERING) Contact has been made.
The host has transferred into the dimensional stabiliser. Activating hypernet energy-stream.
FX: BUTTON PRESSED. THROB OF POWER.
All the power of the human empire, channelled to a greater purpose. Setting materialisation co-ordinates.
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED.
You. Disconnect the Doctor and his companion from the server.
Leaving their minds trapped in the hypernet?
Never to return to their bodies. Disconnect them.
Disconnecting.
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED. LIFE SUPPORT GIVES LONG BLEEEEP OF DEATH.
It is done.
Now. Delete them. Permanently and irretrievably!
Commencing deletion...
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 131
91. INT. CPU.
Doctor, I feel... different.
Yes. Our bodies have been disconnected from the server.
So we can’t go back to them?
No. Even assuming they are still alive to go back to.
FX: BACKGROUND F/X CHANGES. DEEP GRINDING, A CATHEDRAL BEING
PIECE BY PIECE, CHUNKS OF MASONRY SLIDING.
What’s that... hey. All the lights are going out.
Somebody is deleting this portion of the hypernet.
What? With us on it?
I think that’s the general idea. The whole fortress will vanish in a matter of seconds. We have to get outside. Quickly!
(RUNS) The doors are closed! (CALLS OUT) Password! Password!
FX: DOOR OPENS. THEY’RE OUTSIDE, HIGH ALTITUDE WIND. FAMILIAR
SOUND OF APPROACHING SWARM.
Uh-oh. The swarm’s back. And heading this way.
Heading for you. The nucleus will have programmed them to leave me well alone.
You mean, they’re going to tear me to bits, while you watch?
Yes. Assuming we both don’t get deleted first...
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page
92. INT. HUB CONTROL ROOM.
The Doctor and Ace are trapped by swarm duplicates.
Delete the whole memory block! Including the duplicates!
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED.
Deleting memory block... now!
FX: BUTTONS PRESSED WITH FINALITY.
END OF PART THREE
REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 133

LUGERMAN: That’s what I’m trying to tell you. We can’t even send out a request for help.
TALIN: Then we’re on our own. Wait.
LUGERMAN: What is it?
TALIN: The unauthorised object. Two more humanoids are coming out...
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page
ACE: (VIA MONITOR)
ACE: Hey, we haven’t moved. We’re still in the reception place.
DOCTOR: (VIA MONITOR)
DOCTOR: We’re still on asteroid K-4-0-6-7 but we have moved. The
DOCTOR: asteroid’s position in space has changed.
DOCTOR: 93
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 94
ACE: You know what I meant.
DOCTOR: We have also moved forward in time.
ACE: Two hundred years.
DOCTOR: What?
ACE: Something Hector said just before he zapped me. And they’ve changed the decor. I don’t think this is a hospital anymore.
DOCTOR: No. No pot plants or inspirational murals.
ACE: So why do you think it’s come here?
DOCTOR: (VIA MONITOR)
DOCTOR: I’m not sure. In the past, it was simply trying to make sure history happened as written. But now it’s in the future it has a blank page.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 95
TALIN: But it can’t be... it is! Lugerman, it’s them. They’ve come back.
LUGERMAN: Who? What do you mean?
TALIN: Which means we must be facing another outbreak. Lock down! Seal all bulkheads!
LUGERMAN: But the emergency defence systems —
TALIN: We can by-pass the computer and close them manually, can’t we?
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM
TALIN: (VIA TANNOY )
TALIN: Page 96
TALIN: All personnel. Seal all sections using manual over-ride. Do not attempt to engage intruders or anyone who has come into contact with them. They are suffering from infectious psychosis.
SECURITY GUARD TWO: They have been alerted to our presence.
HECTOR: We must reach the server room!
SECURITY GUARD TWO: It’s too late. We’re trapped.
HECTOR: The swarm is not so easily defeated.
HECTOR: The computer is on our side. It serves the nucleus!
HECTOR: Follow me!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 97

DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 98
ACE: “Suffering infectious psychosis”. Sounds like Hector’s drawn attention to himself.
DOCTOR: Yes. The swarm is probably on a recruitment drive. We have to find whoever’s in charge, and -
ACE: Hey, Doctor, watch out!
DOCTOR: That was very nearly my umbrella.
ACE: That was very nearly the rest of you. Well, we can’t go back —
TALIN: (VIA TANNOY ) This is Supervisor Talin. Intruders in corridor X 4 will halt and pay attention.
ACE: (WHISPER) X 4? Hey, that’s us.
TALIN: (VIA TANNOY ) Listen. You must proceed to the server room, I’ve kept a route
TALIN: open and will close the bulkheads off behind you.
DOCTOR: Thank you, we’re most grateful -
TALIN: (VIA TANNOY ) You can thank me when you get here, Doctor.

DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 99

LUGERMAN: And then we’ll be boxed in for good.
TALIN: Just wait for our visitors to pass through — and they’re in.
DOCTOR: Ha! We made it! Hello!
TALIN: Doctor. You look just as you did when you first visited the centre, back when it was the Bi-Al Foundation. And this must be your friend, Ace.
ACE: How do you know who we are?
TALIN: When I became Supervisor of this hub-point, I familiarised myself with the archives. History is an indulgence of mine. You came here twice before, Doctor? Assuming that was you.
DOCTOR: Oh, the fellow with the scarf, yes, that was me.
LUGERMAN: Supervisor, shall I —
TALIN: Yes, Lugerman, secure the final bulkhead.
ACE: You’re locking us in?
TALIN: And locking the infected personnel out.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 100
DOCTOR: So you have some idea what we’re up against?
TALIN: An intelligent swarm virus, first outbreak recorded 4920, second outbreak 5000. Believed eradicated. Wrongly, as it turns out.
DOCTOR: Yes, well, we all make mistakes. Have you isolated Hector and the infected personnel?
TALIN: As best as we can. We’ve been having some computer trouble.
DOCTOR: That’s computers for you. Sorry, what did you say this place was? A ‘hub-point’?
TALIN: After the Bi-Al Foundation was decommissioned, the centre was repurposed as a hypernet relay station.
ACE: What’s the hypernet when it’s at home?
TALIN: A network linking together the entire human empire using transmissions sent through hyperspace using a process of quantum entanglement.
DOCTOR: Faster than light?
TALIN: Oh, much faster. Distant solar systems can exchange information in a matter of milliseconds, it’s virtually instantaneous. It’s what binds the empire together.
DOCTOR: Oh what a tangled web we weave.
ACE: So basically it’s just the internet, but across the galaxy?
TALIN: I can’t really think of a way of describing it more basically.
ACE: And that’s what the swarm wants? To take over the hypernet?
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 101
TALIN: Or destroy it.
DOCTOR: Or use it. I think I’m beginning to see what it wants. The computer. Of course!
LUGERMAN: I’ve done it, we’re sealed in.
TALIN: Well, whatever it wants, it can’t do it, because the only access point is here in this room.
ACE: Doctor, what do you mean, ‘the computer’?
DOCTOR: The swarm didn’t take the TARDIS dimensional stabiliser to keep us here. It needs it for something else. Something it’s been used for before —
LUGERMAN: What’s happening? A power cut?
ACE: Somebody forget to put 50p in the meter?
TALIN: Impossible, the hub has its own power supply, it must be... the computer.
DOCTOR: Not the computer. The nucleus within it.
COMPUTER: (TANNOY, VIRUS VOICE EFFECT)
COMPUTER: Yes, Doctor. The computer is my host. For two centuries I have made the hypernet my nest, absorbing information, expanding my intelligence, drawing together the threads of the web. I have watched as the human race spread across the stars like a disease. Little realising that I controlled the source of their power. The nucleus of the swarm and the master of the hypernet!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 102
SECURITY GUARD TWO: The bulkhead will not open.
HECTOR: The locking mechanism has been destroyed. Not even the computer can open it now.
SECURITY GUARD TWO: Then we have failed.
HECTOR: No. The host controls every circuit within this centre. It is only a matter of time.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 103
ACE: So the virus is now a computer virus?
DOCTOR: Yes. The cloned nucleus uploaded its mind into the Bi-Al Foundation computer, just as it did with the TARDIS. Now it exists as pure information, a sequence of noughts and ones.
COMPUTER: But soon I shall be so much more that. I shall achieve metamorphosis!
DOCTOR: Of course. That’s what it wanted the RDS for.
ACE: (SARCASTIC) Of course. It’s all so obvious now that you fail to explain it.
DOCTOR: It wants to become corporeal. Am I right?
COMPUTER: You are correct, Doctor. I shall be recreated using the dimensional stabiliser and the power of the hypernet. I will be computer generated! More impressive than ever before!
TALIN: Can it do that?
DOCTOR: Oh yes. But it needs the RDS to be connected to the hypernet server.
LUGERMAN: Which is in this room.
DOCTOR: Makes things interesting, doesn’t it? We’re locked in with the one thing it wants.
COMPUTER: You will allow my servants access to the server. Or I will kill you all. I could deactivate the life-support in an instant!
DOCTOR: You could, but then you’d kill off your own followers too, and then where would you be?
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 104
ACE: There’s a phrase that springs to mind involving a creek and a paddle.
COMPUTER: Then I shall make you another offer. Look at the visiphone.
HECTOR: (VIA MONITOR) Doctor. You will allow us into the server room.
HECTOR: Or I will shoot this security guard — and then myself.
COMPUTER: Well, Doctor? I know you would rather submit than allow an innocent to die.
DOCTOR: Yes, you’ve tried that trick before. But let me warn you. If you harm anyone, I’1ll make sure the server is completely and irrevocably destroyed!
COMPUTER: You do not know how.
DOCTOR: Then it’s lucky I brought an explosives expert with me.
ACE: Yeah. I can blow up anything. Look in Hector’s head if you don’t believe me. So let me make you an offer, bug-brain. Release Hector or I’1l blitz the server.
COMPUTER: If the server is non-operational, I will no longer have any reason to keep anyone alive. I will deactivate the life-support and everyone will die while I will live on within the hypernet.
DOCTOR: Then it seems we’ve reached something of an impasse.
LUGERMAN: And anyway, we couldn’t re-open the bulkheads even if we wanted to. It would take weeks, months to repair the circuits.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 105
HECTOR: We must proceed to the engineering store on level 9-X.
SECURITY GUARD TWO: What is our purpose?
HECTOR: We shall return with laseron drills and burn through the bulkhead.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 106
TALIN: They’re giving up.
LUGERMAN: No, they’re up to something, I feel sure of it.
TALIN: Doctor, what you doing with the server?
DOCTOR: I thought I might try a little... debugging.
ACE: Debugging?
DOCTOR: The only way to neutralise the nucleus is to confront it in its own territory.
TALIN: You mean, inside the computer?
DOCTOR: Yes. I’m trying to improvise a way of gaining mental access.
LUGERMAN: Something like a neural interface helmet?
DOCTOR: Yes. (FX: STOPS REWIRING) Why, do you have one?
LUGERMAN: Of course. We use them for checking glitches in the code. We
LUGERMAN: have a few sets in the storeroom.
DOCTOR: Fetch one.
ACE: What exactly does a neural interface helmet do?
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 107
TALIN: It allows the wearer to upload their mind into the cybercosm while their body is kept alive in a cataleptic trance.
ACE: You mean a sort of brain-dead coma?
TALIN: Until the mind is downloaded back into the brain, yes.
ACE: Like in The Matrix, I get it. Lugerman, fetch another helmet.
DOCTOR: What? Ace -
ACE: You don’t think I’m letting you go in there on your own?
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 108
HECTOR: Connect the drill to the power supply.
SECURITY GUARD TWO: Drill connected.
HECTOR: How long will it take to cut through the bulkhead?
SECURITY GUARD TWO: Thirty minutes.
HECTOR: Then that is how long the Doctor and his friends have left to live. Begin.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 109
LUGERMAN: They’re trying to burn their way in.
ACE: Can they do it?
LUGERMAN: Given time, a laseron drill can cut through anything.
TALIN: We could threaten to destroy the server.
DOCTOR: And cut off the entire solar system from the hypernet? They’d know you’d never go through with it. And besides, Ace and I will have our minds in the hypernet and it would be quite nice to be able to get back.
ACE: Speaking of, are we going to go into this thing or what?
DOCTOR: Yes. Connecting neural interfaces.
TALIN: I’1ll monitor your progress and give you as much assistance as I
TALIN: Can.
DOCTOR: Thankyou, and if we do somehow manage to succeed, get us out.
TALIN: I will.
DOCTOR: Even if there’s only one of us left.
ACE: Oh great, vote of confidence.
TALIN: Brace yourselves. The upload may be a little uncomfortable...
DOCTOR: Just do it. Log us on!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 110
TALIN: Uploading.
TALIN: ACE/DOCTOR
TALIN: And they’re in...
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 111
DOCTOR WHO: SOUNDS, BABBLING DATA STREAMS, RAPID BEEPS, AN OVERWHELMING,
IMMERSIVE: BURST OF ELECTRONIC MUSIC.
IMMERSIVE: ACE/DOCTOR (REACT AS THOUGH GOING OVER NIAGARA FALLS IN A BARREL, CALLING
OUT: EACH OTHER’S NAMES)
DISTANT: TINKLES AS DATA PACKETS ARE SENT BACK AND FORTH. LOTS OF COMPUTER-WORLDY SOUNDS, LIKE AN 80S VIDEO GAME.
DOCTOR: Ace, are you alright?
ACE: Virtually. So this is the hypernet?
DOCTOR: Yes. We’re inside the mind of the computer web. This is a... symbolic representation of the logical net.
ACE: And us? It feels like I’m really standing here.
DOCTOR: We’re both symbolic representations of ourselves. Avatars.
ACE: Like characters in a computer game?
DOCTOR: Yes. Or icons.
ACE: Great. I’ve always wanted to know what it felt like to be Jet Set Willy.
DOCTOR: The difference being if a computer game character is killed, they have more than one life.
ACE: But if we die here —
DOCTOR: Game over. Our minds and memories have been converted into data packets, which can be corrupted or erased. And if that happens, there will be nothing of us left to return to our real bodies.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 112
ACE: So they’1l just be brain-dead, kept alive by machines?
DOCTOR: Yes. Let’s not linger here a moment longer than we have to.
ACE: Where are we going?
DOCTOR: The nucleus will have made its nest in the central processor.
ACE: And where’s that?
DOCTOR: You see those glowing green lines of numbers in the sky?
ACE: They all lead to those mountains. But there’s a whole city between us and there... All sorts of square buildings and
ACE: skyscrapers but as outlines.
DOCTOR: Symbolic representations of blocks of memory.
ACE: And it’s miles away. It’ll take days, weeks!
DOCTOR: Then let’s make a start, shall we?
DOCTOR: And, of course, our perception of time is altered. One hour in the hypernet is the equivalent of one minute on the outside.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 113
LUGERMAN: Are they alright?
TALIN: Successful transfer of data, no errors detected. And both their real-world bodies have recovered from the shock.
TALIN: WITH ACE’S HEARTBEAT.
TALIN: All mental activity suspended save for brainstem function.
LUGERMAN: So where are their avatars?
TALIN: Uploaded to the hinterlands of the tertiary cache. Anywhere closer to the C.P.U. and there’d be a risk of them disturbing the traffic flow and being detected. But at the current rate, they should be there in about thirty minutes.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 114
ACE: How long have we been walking for?
DOCTOR: How long does it feel like?
ACE: I don’t know. A day?
DOCTOR: But do you feel tired? Hungry? Thirsty?
ACE: No, but that doesn’t stop it being boring. Now we’re in the city, we can’t see the mountains so I’m not even sure we’re going in the right direction —
ACE: What’s that?
DOCTOR: A proximity alarm. We must’ve been going in the right direction.
ACE: So the nucleus knows we’re here?
DOCTOR: Oh yes.
DOCTOR: BATS, SCREECHING AND CLAWING.
ACE: Then hadn’t we get under cover, out here in the open we’re sitting — look!
DOCTOR: The swarm.
ACE: It’s like a flock of... insects. No. Not insects. Prawns?
DOCTOR: The nucleus. It’s sending copies of itself to attack us.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 115
ACE: You never mentioned it looked like seafood!
DOCTOR: Looks aren’t important.
ACE: They’ve spotted us. What do we now? Run?
DOCTOR: Run!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 116
LUGERMAN: They’ve been detected, the nucleus has sent a viral swarm to their memory location. We have to pull them out.
TALIN: What good would that do? They’d be just as dead on the outside.
LUGERMAN: Then what are you doing?
TALIN: Evening the odds...
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 117
ACE: It’s no good, they’re too fast...
DOCTOR: Then we have no choice. We’ll have to stand and fight.
ACE: With what?
DOCTOR: This! (DRAWS OUT UMBRELLA) En garde!
ACE: Doctor. That’s not a sword, that’s an umbrella.
DOCTOR: Isn’t there a saying about umbrellas being mightier than the sword?
ACE: No, you’re thinking of pens.
DOCTOR: Umbrellas are mightier than pens?
ACE: This is it, they’re circling to attack - !
LASER: SWORD, THROBBING LIKE A LIGHT-SABRE.
DOCTOR: (SWORDFIGHTING) Ha! Have at you! (AD-LIB) Didn’t like that did you? Gonna have another go? Ha! You’1l have to try harder than that!
ACE: It’s a light-sabre-umbrella!
DOCTOR: (SWORDFIGHTING) Yes. I taught Tycho Brahe everything he knows. Should hold them off for a while. Ha! Ha!
ACE: While what? We have to get out of here.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 118
DOCTOR WHO: OF THIN AIR.
DOCTOR: (SWORDFIGHTING) Looks like someone heard you. A little help from above, courtesy of Supervisor Talin.
ACE: Gordon Bennett! They’re like Harley Davidsons.
DOCTOR: But they’re not Harley Davidson’s. They’re ours.
ACE: (CLIMBING ON) Light-bikes. Wicked!
DOCTOR: (CLIMBING ON) Are you sure you know how to ride a motorcycle?
ACE: You just watch me! Just a matter of giving it enough welly.
ACE: Come on, sSlowcoach!
DOCTOR: Slowcoach. Who’s she calling slow (FX: HE REVS UP AND WHOOSHES
OFF: UNEXPECTEDLY) cooooooach!!!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 119
LUGERMAN: You’ve given them bikes from my computer game?
TALIN: I copied across the source code. Just in time, by the look of Lt.
LUGERMAN: They’re escaping!
TALIN: But the host is generating more swarm duplicates, blocking off all routes. (FX: BUTTONS PRESSED) Time to go on the offensive. Make one or two modifications to the code...
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 120
ACE: You alright, Doctor? You look a bit green.
DOCTOR: Just not used to... the acceleration.
ACE: Yeah. Bit different from the buggies on Terra Alpha —
ACE: Uh-oh. Shrimp alert, dead ahead. What do you think, left or right?
DOCTOR: Right.
DOCTOR: KARTS. SWARM FIZZ INTO EXISTENCE.
ACE: More of them. Appearing out of thin air.
DOCTOR: And more behind us. Take the next right.
ACE: They’re catching up. If only I had some —
ACE: Hey, my bike’s grown a cannon! What’s this? “Tomato launcher”?
DOCTOR: I imagine you press the big red button to fire.
ACE: Okay —
ACE: Exploding tomatoes! Awesome!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 121
DOCTOR: Yes, I think you just blew up somebody’s blog.
ACE: And a whole lot of scampi on the side.
ACE: Oh, this is ace. Die, prawn scum, die!
DOCTOR: Don’t get carried away, Ace, they’re just computer game characters. Next right.
ACE: More of them ahead, but I think I can take them out -
ACE: Wahey! And we're free.
DOCTOR: We’re not quite home and dry yet. Head for the mountains.
ACE: No problem. Give me a chance to see just how fast this thing goes...
DOCTOR: Ace! Oh, what’s the use? (FX: HE REVS BIKE, ACCELERATES. AS HE
ZOOMS AWAY: ) Born to be wild! (THIS LINE SHOULD NOT BE SUNG!!!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 122
TALIN: They’re approaching the central processor unit, making good time.
LUGERMAN: And when they get there, then what?
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 123
DOCTOR WHO: AND HALT.
DOCTOR: Here we are. The C-P-U!
ACE: (DISMOUNTS) Looks like a fortress, a castle made out of laser beams and fairy lights.
DOCTOR: (DISMOUNTS) Bear in mind it’s merely a symbolic representation. The reality is that it’s an integrated circuit.
ACE: Yeah. Thought it looked a bit Disney, to be honest. So how do we get in? Knock on the front door?
DOCTOR: Not sure. There must be some sort of password key.
ACE: What, like ‘password’?
DOCTOR: Yes, that should do it.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 124
LUGERMAN: It’s too late. Our friends with the drill are nearly through.
TALIN: We just have to hold on. The Doctor and Ace have just entered the CPU.
LUGERMAN: What, they walked in just like that?
TALIN: Yes, apparently.
LUGERMAN: Meaning the host let them in, they’re walking into a trap. Meanwhile, back in the real world we’re about to die.
TALIN: Yes. Unless. If we can find somewhere to hide... come on!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 125
ELECTRONICA: SOUNDSCAPE. ACE AND DOCTOR APPROACH. DOORS CLOSE.
VIRUS: (DIFFERENT EFFECT, IN ITS DOMAIN) So Doctor. We meet again at last. Welcome to my nest!
DOCTOR: Like a spider sitting at the centre of the galactic web.
ACE: Spider? Looks more like a shrimp to me. I was expecting a big bad, not small fry.
VIRUS: You will not mock the nucleus of the swarm. I am the greatest being the universe has ever known. A sentient virus! With the hypernet at my command!
ACE: Bit full of yourself, aren’t you? For someone so tiny.
ACE: THE GROUND TREMBLE.
VIRUS: Your life is in my hands, human. I will not warn you again.
DOCTOR: The nucleus is right, Ace. Now we’ve entered its nest, we are entirely defenceless.
ACE: You didn’t think to mention that before we walked in?
DOCTOR: I thought it might lead to an awkward conversation. Besides, I’m sure the nucleus means us no harm.
VIRUS: On the contrary, Doctor. I have spent two centuries waiting for this moment, hungering for revenge on the one who destroyed my swarm!
DOCTOR: Oh. Still, never mind, forgive and forget.
VIRUS: No. I shall take great pleasure in devouring you.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 126
DOCTOR: And when you’ve done that, you’1l use my RDS to leave?
VIRUS: And recreate myself, and the swarm, in a magnitude fitting our status! We shall feast upon worlds!
DOCTOR: It pays to think big.
ACE: Yeah, can’t help thinking it’s compensating for something.
VIRUS: You will regret those words.
DOCTOR: Ace has a point. Why do you want to exist in the macrocosm? You were doing very well as a virus, and now in the cyber-cosm you’re all-powerful.
VIRUS: It all began at the moment of my creation. I achieved consciousness, ultra-intelligence, in a glorious rush. I imagined myself greater than all! And then I looked up, and saw an eye looking down at me from above. A vast eye looking at me through a microscope. And I thought. Why am I so small? Why must I be at the mercy of inferior creatures? So I resolved. I would grow, I would breed, multiply and conquer, I would reign supreme!
ACE: I was right. Compensating.
VIRUS: And now the metamorphosis can begin... as the human ‘Hector’ has just gained access to the server room!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 127
HECTOR: At last, the server is ours!
SECURITY GUARD TWO: Who are these two connected to the computer?
HECTOR: The Doctor and Ace. Their bodies are here but their minds are in the machine. Entirely at my mercy. You — search this level. Any humans left alive must join the swarm!
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 128
VIRUS: It is time for me to leave the hypernet.
ACE: What? Just as the party’s getting started?
VIRUS: But before I depart, Doctor, I shall have my revenge and consume your memories!
DOCTOR: Go ahead. Do you worst. Mind you don’t choke.
VIRUS: No. Wait. You would not have entered my domain to die in vain. You would have a plan. It is a trick.
DOCTOR: Who? Me?
VIRUS: Of course. The immunity factor. The C-5-3-1 strain. It was encoded with you. I can scent it coursing through your data stream. If I were to eat you, the digitised antibodies would destroy me, as surely as if I were flesh and blood... That’s why you came.
DOCTOR: Go on, treat yourself. Just a nibble.
VIRUS: No. One bite would be sufficient to poison me and the swarm! I shall leave you here, trapped within the hypernet.
DOCTOR: No, wait. What about all my memories, my intelligence?
VIRUS: If I cannot have it, neither can you. You will be erased, you and your companion. Goodbye, Doctor. It is a pity... You will
VIRUS: never witness the age of the virus!
ACE: It’s gone.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 129
DOCTOR: Yes. Oh well. It was worth a try.
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 130
SECURITY GUARD TWO: I located two humans in the maintenance store. They have joined
SECURITY GUARD TWO: the swarm.
LUGERMAN: (ENTERING) Contact has been made.
TALIN: (ENTERING) Contact has been made.
HECTOR: The host has transferred into the dimensional stabiliser. Activating hypernet energy-stream.
HECTOR: All the power of the human empire, channelled to a greater purpose. Setting materialisation co-ordinates.
HECTOR: You. Disconnect the Doctor and his companion from the server.
TALIN: Leaving their minds trapped in the hypernet?
HECTOR: Never to return to their bodies. Disconnect them.
LUGERMAN: Disconnecting.
LUGERMAN: It is done.
HECTOR: Now. Delete them. Permanently and irretrievably!
TALIN: Commencing deletion...
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 131
ACE: Doctor, I feel... different.
DOCTOR: Yes. Our bodies have been disconnected from the server.
ACE: So we can’t go back to them?
DOCTOR: No. Even assuming they are still alive to go back to.
DISMANTLED: PIECE BY PIECE, CHUNKS OF MASONRY SLIDING.
ACE: What’s that... hey. All the lights are going out.
DOCTOR: Somebody is deleting this portion of the hypernet.
ACE: What? With us on it?
DOCTOR: I think that’s the general idea. The whole fortress will vanish in a matter of seconds. We have to get outside. Quickly!
ACE: (RUNS) The doors are closed! (CALLS OUT) Password! Password!
ACE: SOUND OF APPROACHING SWARM.
ACE: Uh-oh. The swarm’s back. And heading this way.
DOCTOR: Heading for you. The nucleus will have programmed them to leave me well alone.
ACE: You mean, they’re going to tear me to bits, while you watch?
DOCTOR: Yes. Assuming we both don’t get deleted first...
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page
TALIN: The Doctor and Ace are trapped by swarm duplicates.
HECTOR: Delete the whole memory block! Including the duplicates!
TALIN: Deleting memory block... now!
TALIN: END OF PART THREE
TALIN: 132
DOCTOR WHO: REVENGE OF THE SWARM Page 133
